title: Retrofit Assessor
description:
About the job

Job Title: Retrofit Assessor

Location: Remote (some office work from Barking)

Job Type: Full-time

Working Hours: 40 hours per week, Mon – Fri

Department: Retrofit Services

Reports To: Survey Manager




Company Overview: For over a decade IZ Energy has been helping people make their homes more energy efficient by installing measures such as insulation, ventilation, and renewable energy technologies. We install measures for homeowners, landlords, housing associations and local authorities across the UK.




We excel in installing energy-efficient solutions that deliver both comfort and savings directly to your home. Our goal is to lead the charge toward a more environmentally friendly and economically efficient future for everyone.




Job Summary: We are seeking a highly motivated, qualified and experienced Retrofit Assessor to join our team. As a Retrofit Assessor you will delivering PAS2035 compliant surveys to domestic properties and providing face to face advice to potential customers on suitable energy efficiency solutions.




Role and Responsibilities: 

Undertake retrofit assessments in accordance with the latest version of the PAS 2035 standard and produce relevant technical reports to support your findings.
Generate complete and professional Retrofit Assessment (RA) packs using company templates and / or software solutions.
Capture relevant geo and time-stamped photographs of relevant interior and exterior property areas, including kitchens, bathrooms, bedrooms, living areas, stores, lofts, heating systems, and external elevations.
Undertake other relevant technical surveys on domestic properties to help with the assessment of energy performance of IZ Energy customer properties.
Perform borescope inspections to assess domestic property fabric conditions. Conduct thorough technical inspections of building fabrics and produce detailed technical reports.
Prepare detailed floor plans and perform appropriate calculations for both gross and net property areas.
Prepare and lodge Energy Performance Certificates (EPCs).
Analyse and recommend potential measure mixes and evaluate measure specific SAP point impact.
Analyse housing stock data to identify potential opportunities for energy efficiency and renewable energy works.
Liaise and collaboratively work other IZ Energy teams to assist with the successful completion of works.
Maintain a wide knowledge and understanding of the domestic energy efficiency sector.
Attend internal and external project and company related meetings as appropriate.
Complete any other reasonable tasks as required by senior managers.




Desirable Qualifications & Experience 

Full UK Driving Licence & Own Transportation
Qualified Domestic Energy Assessor
Qualified Domestic Retrofit Assessor
Proven experience in the domestic energy efficiency sector
Good understanding of UK funding schemes for energy efficiency
Hold relevant additional qualifications within the domestic retrofit sector
Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills




What we have to offer: 

Competitive Salaries
Sick pay
Holiday pay plus bank holidays
Private Health Care
Free Parking onsite
Employee Reward Scheme
Pension Scheme
Training Opportunities
PDR Appraisal programme




If you are interested in this vacancy, we would like to hear from you. Please ensure to include an up-to-date CV with your application and name the file in the format: FirstName_ LastName.

description:

AES is dedicated to helping commercial clients transition to greener, lower-cost, and more independent energy sources. Our services are geared towards providing sustainable and efficient energy solutions.

This is a full-time remote role for a Dual Fuel Smart Meter Engineer. The Engineer will be responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing dual-fuel smart meters. title: Metering Installation Technician
description:
About the job

About the job

Company Description

MeterXpert are a leading smart metering provider in the secondary metering space. We work with partners and end-users to install, maintain, collect, and visualise data on energy management and tenant billing systems.

Our team is dedicated to delivering exceptional service and technology-agnostic solutions tailored to meet our customers specific needs.

We provide EMS software to help optimise energy consumption and improve efficiency. Our commitment to excellence has earned us a reputation as a trusted partner in the industry.




Responsibilities

This is a full-time role for a Metering Installation Technician working across the UK at customer sites. You will be responsible for installing, troubleshooting, and maintaining metering systems. Day-to-day tasks include meter installations (electricity sub-meters), communication equipment, cabling, diagnosing issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction through effective communication and customer service. The technician will work closely with both clients and team members to ensure high-quality service delivery.




Qualifications

BS 7671:2018 qualified electrician
Full UK Driving Licence
Electrotechnical Certification Scheme (ECS) ID and competence card holder for electrotechnical operatives
Experience in electricity meter installations, current transformers
Strong troubleshooting and diagnostic skills
Knowledge of Modbus, LoRaWAN, Low Power RF, IoT Connectivity
Strong IT skills
Effective communication and customer service skills
Experience in cabling and installation procedures
Focus on customer satisfaction and ability to address client concerns promptly
Previous experience in a similar role is a plus
Ability to work independently and efficiently on-site is a must

title: Radio Frequency Engineer
description:
About the job

Our client is a world leader working at the forefront of next generation communications technology in various sectors including Telecommunications, Aerospace & Defence and Critical Infrastructure. 




As their business continues to grow in the UK Aerospace & Defence market, they are looking for an experienced Field Engineer with knowledge of RF Secure Communications. Preferably with a military background, but not essential.




Working on secure communications systems for military and commercial customers, primarily supporting naval platforms.
Working independently with a high degree of autonomy, travelling to customer sites including Naval vessels within the UK and overseas.
Installation, maintenance and defect rectification of the full range of Integrated Communications Systems.
The right candidate must have a strong analytical and technical skills with an emphasis on fault finding.
The client will provide in depth product training via internal product training programmes as well as on-site with Senior Engineers. 




The Field Engineer role reports to the head of the UK Projects and Solutions group; there are opportunities to grow within the company by working towards becoming the Lead Engineer responsible for several projects, or other disciplines such as Project Management or Engineering Management. 




Because the role involves travel, and their customers are in the Defence Industry you must hold a Full UK driving license and be eligible for UK SC and DV Security Clearance.




Additional required skills/experience

Ideally able to demonstrate a good working-level knowledge of RF electronics, ideally within a Military HF/VHF/UHF environment.
Install, maintain and repair legacy/delivered communication systems.
Ideally experienced in creating system test strategy development and validation, verification, and test plan documentation.
Sound understanding of fault-finding TCP/IP Server Based Systems/Networks
Computer literacy.

description:

£33.25 p/h Days | £37.25 p/h Nights (PAYE)

14 Days On / 14 Days Off (SOV)
North East England (Travel Covered)

I

f you're a committed technician looking to level up your career in the wind industry, we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now for this position of Electrical Technician - Wind Turbine or refer a colleague and earn a bonus!

title: QA Analyst
description:
About the job

FinLegal is a Sheﬃeld-based LegalTech company revolutionising the way law ﬁrms manage high-volume claims. Founded in 2019, our platform leverages automation and AI to streamline the entire claims process, oﬀering customisable online portals, automated workﬂows and AI-driven document analysis, signiﬁcantly reducing administrative burden and increasing client satisfaction for legal companies. 




Our team continues to grow, with significant investment driving global expansion, product development and innovative technology solutions. Working in a collaborative learning environment, you’ll find new challenges and opportunities to develop as we evolve. We work hard, aiming for an environment that is rewarding, interesting and friendly, where contribution and enthusiasm are genuinely welcomed. 




Our hybrid working model and use of Slack as our main communication tool encourages interaction and quick information sharing. We innovate while maintaining reliability and trust with our customers, developing products that solve real pain points and give tangible impact. Operating with as flat a structure as possible, plus a culture of open communication and approachable management, it’s an exciting time to join us.




Key Responsibilities:

Manual and API testing of a multi-tenant SaaS product in an Agile environment including cross-browser with an emphasis on mobile first.

description:

title: AI Engineer (Automation)
description:
About the job

What You'll Be Doing

Future are looking for and AI & Automation Engineer to design and implement smart solutions that improve manual business processes. You'll work with modern tools like Temporal.io, n8n.io, Make.com, and various programming languages (Python, Go, Typescript, PHP, and Java) to create custom automations. In this role, you'll collaborate with teams across Sales, Product, Editorial, IT, and Engineering to identify inefficiencies, understand requirements, and build AI-driven solutions—ranging from prompt-engineered LLM tools to automated workflows—for data analysis, quality assurance, and planning.

Reporting to the Director of Engineering - Systems and Ai, you'll lead projects from ideation to production, ensuring systems are scalable, and well-tested using CI/CD pipelines. As a subject matter expert, you'll promote responsible AI use, mentor team members, and help shape best practices and governance frameworks. Keeping pace with advancements in AI, LLMs, and automation technologies, you'll contribute to innovation while documenting solutions and participating in team initiatives like code reviews and hack days.

This role is pivotal in embedding responsible, high-impact AI and automation solutions across Future. You will collaborate across departments (Product, Engineering, Sales, Editorial) to identify opportunities and implement solutions that streamline workflows, enhance productivity, elevate content quality, and drive profitable growth, promoting innovation while upholding Future's values and "trusted, specialist content" ethos.

Experience That Will Put You Ahead Of The Curve


Experience in a relevant technical role - Automation, Software Engineering, AI/ML Engineering
Experience designing and implementing process automation solutions using workflow tools and custom scripting/programming
Proficiency in at least one high-level programming language, such as Python, Go, Javascript/TypeScript, Java, or PHP
Hands-on experience applying AI/ML concepts ( LLMs and embeddings) to solve practical business problems, including familiarity with commercial AI APIs and open-source models
Understanding and practical application of modern software engineering best practices: version control (Git), CI/CD principles, automated testing, writing clean, maintainable code
 Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical ideas effectively to diverse audiences (technical and non-technical) and collaborate across departments
 User Focus & Coaching: A customer-centric mindset, empathy for end-user needs, and a coaching approach with a willingness to share knowledge


What's In It For You

The expected range for this role is £50,000 - £60,000

This is a remote based role


 Plus more great perks, which include;
Uncapped leave, because we trust you to manage your workload and time
When we hit our targets, enjoy a share of our profits with a bonus
Refer a friend and get rewarded when they join Future
Wellbeing support with access to our Colleague Assistant Programmes
Opportunity to purchase shares in Future, with our Share Incentive Plan


Internal job family level Technology 3

Who are we...

We're Future, the global leader in specialist media. With over 3,000 employees working across 200+ media brands, Future is a prime destination for passionate people worldwide looking to consume trusted, expert content that educates and inspires action - both online and off - through our specialist websites, magazines, events, newsletters, podcasts and social spaces.

We've got ambitious plans that further build on our growth momentum and unlock new opportunities - and we're looking for driven people who want to be a part of it!

Our Future, Our Responsibility - Inclusion and Diversity at Future

We embrace and celebrate diversity, making it part of who we are.

Different perspectives spark ideas, fuel creativity, and push us to innovate. That's why we're building a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to thrive.

When it comes to hiring, we keep it fair and inclusive, welcoming talent from every walk of life. It's not just about what you bring to the table — it's about making sure the table has room for everyone.

Because a diverse team isn't just good for business. It's the Future.

Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments made so we can give you the best experience!

Find out more about Our Future, Our Responsibility on our website.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
About the job

Brainpool is a fast growing AI start-up, providing custom AI services for business since 2017. Brainpool network of 500 top-level AI and Machine Learning experts supporting delivery of our projects include PhD and MSc-level scientists from top universities such as UCL, Oxford, Cambridge and Harvard. Brainpool provides companies with end-to-end AI solutions, starting from strategy development, planning all the way to implementation. 




This role will involve working alongside the CTO and a team of engineers, on various business engagements, such as client projects and internal company products. Some examples of these engagements include client scoping programmes, and PoC/MVP software development. A significant focus will be on building and optimizing Large Language Model (LLM) inferences and creating robust web services. This includes developing event-driven and request-response systems to run RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) answer generation pipelines, essential for delivering sophisticated AI-driven solutions. Your role will require strong communication skills to effectively liaise between application and product development teams, as well as to articulate complex technical concepts at varying levels of detail. Your contributions will be pivotal in advancing the company's capabilities in LLM inferences and enhancing the overall quality of AI solutions. 

 

Requirements 

Some experience in programming languages such as Python, C/C++, and familiarity with object-oriented programming. 
Experience of working with or an understanding of LLM frameworks such as Haystack, LlamaIndex, and LangChain, with a focus on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and text/chat generators. 
Cloud computing with AWS (ECS, EKS, DynamoDB, Bedrock) 
Knowledge of git version control, branching, and code versioning. 
Passionate about code quality, adhering to best practices for code quality, performance, testing, monitoring, documentation, CI/CD. 
Experience working in an agile framework preferable, including defining functional and non-functional requirements and sprint tasks. 
Understanding of data engineering, some experience with building production-grade ETL pipelines, as well as backend web development, backend-for-frontend, GraphQL, and FastAPI. 
Strong communication skills, able to communicate with both technical and commercial people. 
BSc or a MSc in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or an Engineering discipline (STEM). 

 

Desirable knowledge and experience 

Understanding of or working with AI/ML algorithms and data science. 
Docker and Kubernetes. 
Experience with Large Language Model stacks, vector databases, Haystack, open-source (Mistral, Falcon, Llama 3), and closed-source models like GPT-4 and Claude. 
Knowledge of Git version control, branching, and code versioning. 




Renumeration:

£35,000 annual salary
Healthcare insurance upon passing probation
24 days holidays

Backed by strong funding, this product-focused team of senior engineers operates in a low-ego, high-collaboration culture. The platform's first focus is on employee wellbeing in high-stress industries—and the mission is just getting started.

title: Full Stack Engineer (Deeptech AI startup)
description:
About the job

Why join us?




At Trismik, we’re a team of tech geeks from Cambridge University, Salesforce, and Amazon. With over 38 years of research behind us, we’re not just building tools - we’re sparking an AI revolution. Our mission is to push AI’s boundaries while keeping it a trusted partner for humanity. If you’re ambitious and ready to make a monumental impact, join us on this thrilling journey.




Role




We are developing adversarial tests for Large Language Models (LLMs). Our goal is to provide the fastest and most accurate testing environment to maximise value for AI engineers deploying AI applications using LLMs. We do this to help companies and researchers to push forward the SoTA in Artificial Intelligence and to achieve the best possible chance of a human-aligned AGI. We are looking for an experienced and proven full-stack software engineer to lead on the software development of our SaaS platform. We are open to hire in the UK and in the EU.

As one of our first hires this is a high-impact and high-ownership role. You will help design the architecture of our product and you will have a strong say in how our technical and product roadmap evolves. 




Key job responsibilities




As one of our first hires, you will work closely with the CTO, and you will be responsible for setting a high bar throughout the software development lifecycle including design, development, documentation, testing and operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software and application development, AWS technologies, business judgement, curiosity, and superior written and verbal communication skills. Your duties will include:




Build and own critical infrastructure for powering AI innovation.
Build and own our web platform, including our website and our APIs and services that enable AI insights.
Work closely with AI researchers and our business team to transform innovative ideas into a production system. 
Lead technical design discussions and drive continuous improvements in system and process.
Ensure our platform meets security and performance standards
Write high-quality, well-tested code following best practices.
Contribute to technical roadmap and strategic planning.




You will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big and be creative while paying careful attention to detail and will enjoy a fast-paced and dynamic environment.




Essential Qualifications




Experience (3 years+) in professional software development as a full-stack engineer.
Knowledge of professional software engineering and best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, software architectures, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing, and operational excellence.
Strong knowledge of: Python, SQL, Angular, Git, AWS, Docker.
Strong English proficiency.

Experience in system architecture design
Experience in CI/CD 
Experience with Scrum/Agile software development
HTML/CSS

Company issued laptop;
Flexible/remote work environment. We are based in Cambridge/London but open to outstanding remote work candidates based in the UK or EU.

Experience setting up CI/CD pipelines for ML workflows and maintaining scalable systems in the cloud.
A proven track record of mentoring peers and leading by example.

A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a similar field.

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the job

Data Engineer Azure Stack | £60,000–£70,000| Leeds – Hybrid (2 days/week)




A leading professional services firm is looking for a hands-on Data Engineer to join them at a pivotal moment in their data journey. This is a unique opportunity to own and shape the development of a modern Azure-based data platform from the ground up — replacing legacy reporting tools, consolidating business-critical data sources, and paving the way for Microsoft Fabric adoption.




The organisation is mid-way through a modernisation programme. They’ve moved away from outdated SAP BO reports and started building a scalable data foundation using Azure Synapse, ADF, and Power BI, with support from a Microsoft partner. They are now looking for someone to take ownership of the platform and guide the business through the next phase of growth.




What You’ll Be Doing




Owning the end-to-end design and delivery of data pipelines using ADF and Synapse
Working with internal systems (finance, HR, case management) to extract, model, and prepare data for reporting
Collaborating closely with a small BI team, advising on how to shape clean, usable datasets for Power BI
Preparing for a move to Microsoft Fabric (training/support available)
Acting as a subject matter expert in data engineering, supporting and educating others along the way
Troubleshooting, managing exceptions, and advising on data quality, security, and integration best practices




What They’re Looking For




Strong SQL skills (essential) – you’ll need to pass a practical SQL assessment
Hands-on experience with the Azure data stack – ADF, Synapse, Azure SQL, Power BI
Comfortable working independently – this is a solo engineering role (for now), so autonomy is key
Good understanding of how to evaluate, connect, and transform new data sources
Curiosity and the ability to think through business problems — not just write code
Exposure to Microsoft Fabric is a bonus, but a willingness to learn and evolve is more important







Be the engineer – the go-to person for all things data platform
Shape how the business uses data from day one
Join a team that values learning, autonomy, and practical delivery
You'll be part of a wider roadmap that includes growth, a senior hire in future, and full Fabric migration
Culture that blends long-standing experience with modern thinking – change is already in motion
Hybrid working (2 days on-site in Leeds), benefits package, and supportive leadership

title: Martech Data Engineer
description:
About the job

Wyoming Interactive is an award-winning digital solutions agency who specialize in designing and engineering innovative solutions that deliver transformative results for industry leaders in Life Sciences, Financial Services and Technology. Through our digital services we help our clients connect and communicate better with their customers.




As we continue to grow, we are seeking a talented Martech Data Engineer to join our team, focusing on implementing and optimizing a fully integrated Martech stack for an international client.

In this role, you'll collaborate with the client's team to define and deliver technical solutions that support business goals and enhance decision-making on a global scale.




The role:

 As a Martech Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in implementing and deploying the client's Martech stack. You'll work closely with their marketing, analytics, and product teams to build and optimize a scalable architecture, including managing an Azure Data Lake Gen2, Azure Data Factory, Snowflake warehouse, and RudderStack for customer data flows. Your responsibilities will include designing and maintaining data integrations from sources such as HubSpot and Shopify, enabling efficient marketing automation and data-driven insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Martech Architecture: Develop and manage a scalable data architecture using Azure and Snowflake.
Data Pipeline Management: Implement and maintain data ingestion and integration from platforms like HubSpot and Shopify.
Client Collaboration: Work within the client project team to ensure the Martech stack meets their specific data needs.
Data Reporting & Visualization: Support reporting and visualization needs using Looker Studio.
Data Governance & Compliance: Implement and maintain data governance practices to uphold data security and integrity.
Troubleshooting & Optimization: Monitor and optimize data pipelines to ensure reliability.




Skills and experience you will bring:

Experience: 3+ years in data engineering or martech engineering roles.
Technical Proficiency:Expertise with Azure Data Lake Gen2, Azure Data Factory and Snowflake.
Experience with Looker Studio for visualization.
Proficiency with RudderStack or similar customer data platforms.
Data Integration Skills: Skilled in ETL/ELT processes, with direct experience integrating platforms such as HubSpot and Shopify.
Programming Skills: Proficient in SQL, Python, or similar languages.
Client-Facing Experience: Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration within a client team, with the ability to communicate technical details to non-technical stakeholders.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with the drinks, consumer goods, or retail sectors.
Data Compliance: Knowledge of data governance frameworks and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Additional BI Skills: Experience with supplementary BI tools or frameworks compatible with Snowflake and Looker Studio.




Why Wyoming Interactive?

We offer a competitive package in a flat, friendly, and progressive environment where we prioritize work-life balance. While we do experience intense periods at times, we always recognize the importance of maintaining this balance and strive to give back wherever we can. We believe in empowering our team members to learn, develop, and take ownership of their work. Regular opportunities for skills development, participation in learning conferences, and engaging in frequent in-house social events at our Edinburgh HQ are all part of our culture.




You'll find an environment that fosters creativity, innovation, and a spirit of fun, including:

Hybrid, remote, in-office, and flexible working patterns available.
Discretionary performance-based bonus.
Annual profit share scheme.
28 days holiday inclusive of Bank Holidays.
Additional holidays for Christmas Day, Boxing Day, and New Year's Day.




Ready to Take the Next Step?

Submit your profile today for review, and let's explore the possibilities together.

By joining our team, you would be joining a group of diverse, highly talented digital experts. We welcome applicants from all walks of life, and believe that diversity fuels creativity, drives innovation, and fosters a culture of inclusion where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute their best work.

Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, designers, and stakeholders to build user-focused solutions

Promote engineering best practices, code quality, and agile development principles

Effective problem-solving skills and the ability to manage complex technical challenges

Remote work from anywhere in the United Kingdom

Private healthcare coverage
Statutory pension and benefits programs
Support for career development and learning
Opportunity to work with modern technologies and global teams
Collaborative, inclusive culture that values experimentation and innovation



Jobgether Hiring Process Disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!

title: Python Developer
description:
About the job

Assystem is an international company with one mission: accelerate the energy transition around the world.

Every day, our 7,500 switchers located in 12 countries (Europe, Middle East, Pacific Asia & Africa) connect their six thousand billion neurons to tackle the task of the century: switching to low-carbon energy.

We are a collective committed to the actors who are making the energy switch. Sharing our knowledge, expertise and values allows us to innovate and think differently about the energy transition.

Drawing on more than 55 years' experience in highly regulated sectors subject to strict security and safety requirements, we provide our customers with engineering and project management services, as well as digital services and solutions to optimise the performance of complex infrastructure projects throughout their life cycle. The Group is currently ranked second in the world for nuclear engineering.

To ensure a viable, efficient, and reliable energy future for all.





Job Description



Back End Python Developer – Join a Leading Force in the Global Energy Transition! 🌍⚡



At Assystem, we're driving the future of energy. As a Back End Python Developer, you’ll have the unique opportunity to play a key role in accelerating the world’s shift to low-carbon energy. With your expertise in Python and cloud technologies, you’ll be shaping the digital services that power the projects at the forefront of the energy revolution.



Why You'll Love This Role:



🌍 Make a Global Impact: Contribute directly to the energy transition and sustainability efforts, helping to create a reliable, low-carbon energy future for all.



💻 Work with Cutting-Edge Technologies: Design and build scalable, efficient, and secure server-side applications and APIs using Python (Django/Flask), alongside innovative cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and GCP.



🤝 Collaboration at its Best: As part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, you’ll work closely with talented professionals across various fields—including product managers, UX designers, and front-end developers—to create world-class solutions.



🚀 Shape the Future: In this role, you'll have the chance to develop APIs that power critical infrastructure, all while adhering to government standards and the best practices of the industry.



📈 Continuous Growth: Assystem is committed to fostering an environment of knowledge sharing, professional development, and continuous learning, ensuring you are always growing your skills in an innovative and forward-thinking company.



Key Responsibilities:



🛠️ Build & Optimize: Develop, test, and maintain high-performance back-end services and APIs that are secure, scalable, and efficient.



📊 Work with Data: You’ll manage both relational (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB) databases, creating flexible and reliable data architectures.



☁️ Cloud Deployment: Gain hands-on experience deploying and managing applications on top-tier cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) with tools like Terraform and CloudFormation.



🔄 Champion CI/CD & Agile: Take ownership of the CI/CD pipeline, ensuring seamless, automated testing and deployment in an Agile environment.



🔒 Ensure Top-Notch Security & Performance: Implement best-in-class security protocols and ensure systems meet the highest performance standards.





Qualifications



Essential Skills & Experience:



🐍 Python Mastery: Strong experience with Django or Flask frameworks.



🌐 API Development Expertise: A proven track record in designing secure, robust RESTful/GraphQL APIs and integrating with third-party services.



☁️ Cloud & DevOps: Experience deploying on AWS, Azure, or GCP, with a focus on infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation) and Docker/Kubernetes.



🔄 Agile Mindset: Hands-on experience in an Agile environment, using Git for version control and managing CI/CD pipelines.



🛡️ Security & Performance Focus: Skilled at implementing authentication, encryption, and performance optimizations.



Desirable Skills:



🚀 Serverless & Microservices: Familiarity with AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, or microservices architectures.



📊 Data & AI: Exposure to big data frameworks, ETL pipelines, or machine learning applications.



🏛️ GDS Standards: An understanding of GOV.UK service standards and accessibility principles would be an added bonus.



 





Additional Information



Why Assystem?



🌟 Innovative Culture: At Assystem, we don’t just follow trends; we set them. By joining our team, you’ll be working alongside the brightest minds in energy and technology.



🌍 Global Reach: With operations across 12 countries, including Europe, the Middle East, and Asia, you’ll be part of a truly international and diverse team.



🌱 Impactful Work: You’ll contribute directly to projects that are shaping the future of energy, helping to reduce carbon footprints and build sustainable infrastructure that benefits people worldwide.



If you’re passionate about coding, cloud technologies, and making a meaningful difference in the world, then Assystem is the place to be. Join us, and let’s power a sustainable future together! 🔋🌿



Why join the Switchers community?



💥 Assystem has over 55 years of experience in nuclear engineering. We are among the top 3 largest nuclear engineering companies.



💥 Attractive social benefits: an engaging and dynamic Employee Committee (CE), holiday bonuses...



💥 Ongoing training throughout your career. Numerous career opportunities: 70% of our managers come from internal promotions!



💥 Will be full time onsite in Derby



Need to obtain SC and sole UK National



We are committed to equal treatment of candidates and promote, as well as foster all forms of diversity within our company. We believe that bringing together people with different backgrounds and perspectives is essential for creating innovative and impactful solutions. Skills, talent, and our people’s ability to dare are the only things that matter !. Bring your unique contributions and help us shape the future.



We are committed to equal treatment of candidates and promote, as well as foster all forms of diversity within our company. We believe that bringing together people with different backgrounds and perspectives is essential for creating innovative and impactful solutions. Skills, talent, and our people’s ability to dare are the only things that matter !. Bring your unique contributions and help us shape the future.

Change Digital are working closely with a Financial Services organisation in the UK who are looking for a Data Engineer to join their existing team. You will have the opportunity to play a pivotal role in building and maintaining the data flows and data acquisition processes to deliver well-structured, efficient and performant data marts to drive business analysis and processes. Reporting to the Data Engineering Lead(s) for direction in terms of priorities or technical support, and support them through delivery of projects/work within deadlines, prompt escalation of risks or issues and ensuring that day to day activities are delivered within SLAs. The majority of their data flow scripts are currently in SAS. You’ll liaise with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation, delivering end to end data requests and ensuring single version of the truth across the organisation.




What you’ll be doing:

Application Software Development: Contribute to development of existing and new applications by analyzing and identifying areas for modification and improvement. Contribute to development of new applications to meet customer requirements.
Product/Service Development: Solve known problems and/or deliver defined outcomes by performing designated development/engineering activities using existing systems.
Faults Diagnosis and Correction: Provide fault isolation and resolution to limit and address issues promptly.
Technical Developments Recommendation: Research and suggest technical developments to improve quality of the website/portal/software and supporting infrastructure to better meet users’ needs.
Project Management: Support others by carrying out a range of project management activities.
Technical Database Support: Design distribution of basic database resources and provide physical modelling and design services to tune database applications for optimum performance.
Data Architecture: Maintain a data recording process/system, performing functions such as data archiving and updating.
Data Collection and Analysis: Produce accurate reports for others by collecting data from a variety of standard sources and inputting it into standard formats.
Data Exploration: Produce accurate reports for others by collecting data from a variety of standard sources and inputting that data into standard formats.
Data Management: Help others get the most out of data management systems by providing support and advice.




We need you to have:

Ability to analyse and interpret data with good investigative and analytical skills and make recommendations.
Strong communication skills (both verbal and written) with non-technical internal colleagues.
In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office (particularly Excel).
Proven organisation skills with the ability to work with tight deadlines.
Able to demonstrate sound attention to detail, ensuring any output is accurate before being passed onto the wider business.
Experience developing and maintaining strong working relationships.
Demonstrate a ‘Can Do’ attitude with a desire to thrive in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
Some knowledge of SQL / SAS is preferred but not essential.
Sound experience and understanding of established procedures or systems.
Evidence of problem solving, investigative and analytical skills.
Evidence of learning technical skills.
Insurance or other financial services experience would be beneficial.




This role is urgent in nature so please email your CV to mitesh.fatnani@change-digital.co.uk or call 077 375 38 248 for more information.

Manual Testers / QA Analysts & Automation Testing

Execute test cases manually.
Focus on UI/UX, functionality, user stories, and regression.
Tools: Excel, TestRail, Zephyr, Jira, Quality Center.
Create and execute automated test scripts.
Improve test coverage, speed up regression cycle.

Tools:

UFT (Unified Functional Testing) – enterprise tool for functional/regression testing (VBScript).
Selenium
Cypress
Appium
Playwright, TestComplete, Ranorex, Robot Framework.




Multiple Deliverables

SDET Testing (Software Development Engineer in Test)

Ideally Developer-tester hybrid.
Write testing frameworks and also contribute to production code.
Strong coding background (Java, Python, C#, etc.).
Build integration and end-to-end automation pipelines.




Performance / Load Testing

Simulates real-world load and stress on systems.
Ensures system performance, scalability, and reliability.
Tools: JMeter, LoadRunner, Gatling, Neoload.




Functional Testing

Verify that software functions as per business requirements.




Integration Testing

Focus on ensuring different modules/components interact correctly.
Test APIs, databases, and service flows.




Security Testing & Penetration Testing (Ethical Hacking)

Simulate attacks to find vulnerabilities.
Tools: Burp Suite, OWASP ZAP, Metasploit.
CEH, OSCP, CISSP certifications an advantage




Vulnerability Testing

Scan systems for known vulnerabilities.
Collaborate with SecOps and DevSecOps teams.




Security QA / Secure Code Testing

Test software from a secure coding perspective.
Ensure compliance with secure development standards (OWASP Top 10, etc.).




Test Management

Oversee testing across multiple teams and or products.
Handle stakeholder communication, budget, vendor selection, and process compliance.




Test Architectecture

Design testing frameworks, strategies, and toolchains.
Advise on choosing tools (e.g., UFT vs Selenium) and scaling automation.




API Testing

Validate REST/SOAP APIs for functionality, reliability, security.
Tools: Postman, SoapUI, RestAssured, Swagger.




Mobile Testing

Focus on mobile app quality across Android/iOS devices.
Manual and automation testing using Appium, XCUITest, TestFairy.




Data / ETL Testing

Ensures accurate data flow, transformation, and validation in data pipelines.
Works with SQL, Informatica, Talend, SSIS, Snowflake.




AI / ML Model Testing

Test models for accuracy, bias, and performance.
Involves validating model predictions, fairness, and ethical AI compliance.

Associate
Industry
IT Services and IT Consulting
Employment Type
Full-time
Job Functions
Information Technology
Skills
Test Automation
Functional Testing
Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing (VAPT)
Test Management
Selenium

description:
About the job

Job Description: Analyst/Associate – Web3 Incubation & Venture Team

Company: Trireme Trading

Location: [On-site/Hybrid]

About Trireme Trading

Trireme Trading is a pioneering quantitative hedge fund and market leader in the cryptocurrency space, leveraging cutting-edge technology and high-frequency trading strategies to deliver exceptional liquidity solutions. We partner with groundbreaking Web3 projects and ecosystems globally, bridging the gap between innovative blockchain ventures and market success. Our incubation and venture arm operates at the forefront of Web3, supporting early-stage startups with tokenomics design, fundraising, go-to-market strategies, and ecosystem growth.




Position Overview

We are seeking a dynamic Analyst/Associate to join our Incubation, Acceleration, and Venture Team. This role is pivotal in driving the success of Web3 startups through hands-on support in tokenomics, product strategy, fundraising, Go-To-Market and more. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (Quant, Engineering, Trading) and external stakeholders (founders, exchanges, investors) to ensure our portfolio projects thrive in competitive markets.

The ideal candidate combines deep crypto/Web3 expertise with operational rigor, strategic thinking, and a passion for nurturing early-stage ventures. If you thrive in fast-paced environments, excel at synthesizing complex information, and want to shape the future of blockchain innovation, this role is for you.




Key Responsibilities

Conduct due diligence on accelerator applicants, evaluating teams, tokenomics, GTM, and competitive positioning.
Strong understanding of Web3 sectors (DeFi, AI, RWA, GameFi, Infrastructure).
Manage client relationships, onboarding, milestone tracking, and cross-team coordination.
Advise portfolio projects on fundraising, token launches, listings, partnerships and more.
Craft tokenomics frameworks, GTM, and investor strategies for early-stage startups.
Perform market research to identify narratives, chain-specific opportunities, and threats.
Design and optimize workflows for reporting, documentation, and stakeholder updates.
Build and maintain networks with Web3 founders, investors, and partners.

Qualifications

1–5 years in Web3 VC, incubation, launchpads, or research.
Proven track record in Web3.
Experience with cross-functional teams in fast-paced environments.
Strong understanding of blockchain ecosystems and crypto market dynamics.
Proficiency in Notion, Excel, on-chain analytics (Messari, Nansen, Dune)
Proficiency in SQL, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences.
Self-starter with adaptability, attention to detail, and passion for Web3.
Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple priorities under pressure.

What We Offer

Competitive salary
Exposure to top Web3 projects and industry leaders
Collaborative, high-impact culture at the intersection of trading and venture building
Rapid professional growth opportunities in a hyper-growth sector

How to Apply

Submit your resume, a brief cover letter highlighting your Web3 experience, and examples of relevant work (e.g., tokenomics models, investment memos, GTM, and fundraising strategies).

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
About the job

Full Stack Engineer

Product Engineering · London, England, United Kingdom · Full-time

DESCRIPTION

As a scale up, the engineering organisation will grow considerably by end FY24/25. To start, we adapted an existing platform to address a new market opportunity and prove our commercial thesis. With this achieved, we secured funding to support our expansion and have embarked on an ambitious scaling of our product engineering team that will rapidly evolve our platform using the latest cloud-native and full-stack technologies to achieve a leadership position in our selected markets. We seek ambitious product engineers (not just software developers) with experience in cloud-native approaches that can shape our platform strategy and accelerate our product development plans.

 THE ROLE 

As a Full Stack Product Engineer for our client, you will play a pivotal role in developing new product solutions and features within our modern product squad. You will utilise your skills in React, TypeScript, C#, and .Net to deliver comprehensive and innovative solutions. You will create new products and features that drive our platform forward and contribute to the ongoing complex modernisation and migration from our .Net Framework platform to a microservices architecture based on .Net Core.

You will work closely with the product owner, lead engineers, stakeholders, and customers to refine requirements and deliver high-quality solutions. Your contributions will enhance our cloud-based treasury management system, fostering rapid innovation and improving both user experience and platform capabilities.

As an experienced or regular engineer, you are expected to work independently, delivering high-quality solutions to our stakeholders. Within a squad environment, you will translate complex requirements into engineered solutions. Joining a team of ambitious product experts, your contribution will be pivotal in establishing a world-class engineering organization and cementing our leadership in the marketplace.




 YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES 

Platform Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enhance our treasury management platform, implementing both back-end services and front-end applications using React, TypeScript, C#, and .Net.
New Product Development: Focus on designing and implementing new product solutions and features, ensuring they meet high standards of quality, scalability, and performance.
Microservices Migration: Assist in migrating from a monolithic architecture to a microservices architecture, leveraging .Net Core and industry best practices to ensure scalability and maintainability.
Innovation and Best Practices: Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies, applying best practices to continuously improve our platform’s performance and security.
Autonomous Work: Operate independently within a squad environment, translating complex requirements into engineered solutions and adhering to SOLID principles and other coding standards.
Collaboration: Work closely with the product owner, lead engineers, stakeholders, and customers to gather requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
Code and Design Reviews: Undertake code and design reviews, contributing to ongoing improvements in security and authentication practices.
Development and Testing: Develop, unit test, and integrate new features according to specific designs and user stories.
Documentation: Create high-quality documentation supported by example code as required, particularly around authentication flows and security protocols.
Continuous Learning: Continuously learn and implement relevant best practices in collaboration with the wider team.
Mentoring: Provide feedback and guidance to more junior engineers to help them grow ad achieve their goals.

Requirements

Strong proficiency with .Net Core, +3 years (.Net Framework experience ideal).
Extensive front experience with React and ideally Typescript
Professional experience in a distributed microservice architecture using asynchronous event-driven communications, DDD, and automated CI/CD pipelines.
Fluent with Agile methods and collaborative working practices.
Good understanding of SOLID principles, service-oriented architecture, and a particular appreciation for security best practices in software development.
Confident in both oral and written communication.
Proactively updates the team and seeks feedback from stakeholders.
Degree or relevant qualification required

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About the job

Machine Learning Engineer (Medical & Drug Discovery)

Oxford (2 days a week onsite)

Competitive (Up to £85,000, DOE)




Join a leading innovator in medical and drug discovery, using AI to accelerate healthcare breakthroughs. If you're passionate about applying machine learning to complex biological challenges, this is your chance to make a real impact.




Role Overview:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll design and optimize AI models to advance biomedical research. You'll collaborate with data scientists, bioinformaticians, and scientific experts to transform large datasets into actionable insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, train, and deploy ML models for protein structure, drug-target interactions, and biomarker discovery.
Build data pipelines for large biomedical datasets (genomics, clinical, molecular).
Implement deep learning models (e.g., CNNs, RNNs, transformers) for biological analysis.
Apply NLP to process biomedical literature and clinical data.
Collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams to ensure models meet scientific goals.
Continuously monitor and improve model performance.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics, or related field.
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with bioinformatics tools (e.g., Biopython, RDKit).
Strong knowledge of statistical models, deep learning, and data preprocessing.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization (Docker).
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.




Desirable:

Experience with generative models (e.g., GANs, VAEs).
Knowledge of molecular docking, cheminformatics, or systems biology.
Understanding of regulatory and data privacy in healthcare AI.




Benefits:

Competitive salary and equity options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage.
Opportunities for professional growth and research collaboration.
Flexible working environment, including remote options.




Help us drive the future of healthcare through AI-powered discoveries. Your work could lead to the next breakthrough drug or life-saving treatment.




Please apply ASAP to discuss further

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the job

About Us:

We aim to help students realise their potential in the world of work through technology, content and tools. That’s not an easy thing. 




We believe in understanding students and partnering with employers, universities, schools and other technology providers. 




It’s about students finding the right role and employers finding the most suitable candidates. But its more than that – it’s about helping young people discover options, develop and build confidence. 




Mission:

As a key member of the Data Team, you will drive the evolution of our data infrastructure, ensuring that teams across the business have access to accurate, actionable insights. You will work cross-functionally to shape data strategy, optimise pipelines, and enable predictive analytics. A particular focus will be on strengthening the data foundations of our product suite and customer-facing analytics, helping move from descriptive to proactive and prescriptive insights.




Role Outcomes:

We have a coherent data strategy and are delivering against it:

Define and implement a clear data strategy that aligns with business priorities and product development.
Ensure data governance principles are in place, maintaining accuracy, security, and compliance.
Establish scalable data models that support both operational and strategic decision-making, with awareness of emerging AI/ML opportunities.




We have efficient, scalable data infrastructure that supports analytics and automation:

Design and optimize data pipelines, ensuring high availability and performance.
Eliminate data silos by integrating sources across our platforms for a unified view.
Drive automation in data workflows to reduce manual effort and improve reliability.




Stakeholders across the business have access to the insights they need to make informed decisions:

Develop self-serve analytics capabilities through dashboards and reporting tools.
Proactively identify and surface insights that improve business performance, including AI-enhanced analytics where beneficial.
Enable leadership and operational teams to leverage data effectively in decision-making.




Our cross-platform tracking is robust and enables accurate measurement of user behaviour:

Ensure consistent tracking across our products, eliminating data inconsistencies.
Implement best practices for attribution, funnel analysis, and performance monitoring.
Maintain alignment with industry standards for behavioural tracking and analytics.




We foster strong collaboration between Data, Tech, Product, and Commercial teams:

Act as a trusted advisor, translating business needs into technical solutions.
Communicate complex data concepts in a clear and actionable way.
Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to drive data-driven decision-making.




Person Specification:

This role is ideal for a strategic thinker who enjoys solving complex problems and enabling data-driven decision-making. You will be working with a wide range of stakeholders, from technical teams to senior leadership, requiring strong communication and problem-solving skills.




Strong analytical mindset with the ability to design and implement scalable data solutions
Excellent stakeholder management skills, able to translate technical concepts into business value
Proactive and adaptable, with a strong ability to work independently and drive initiatives forward
Comfortable navigating ambiguity and balancing strategic goals with hands-on execution




Work Experience, Knowledge & Skills:

This role sits at the intersection of data strategy, analytics, and infrastructure. While deep technical expertise is not a prerequisite, a solid foundation in data technologies is required.




SQL & Data Modelling: Strong experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL)
Python for Data Processing: Experience in Python for automation, ETL, and analytics
AWS & Cloud Data Technologies: Familiarity with AWS services such as S3, Redshift, Athena, and Lambda is highly beneficial
BI & Reporting Tools: Understanding of BI/MI platforms (e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau)
Version Control & Engineering Best Practices: Experience with Git and collaborative coding workflows is beneficial
Web & Behavioural Analytics: Familiarity with tracking tools like Google Analytics, Matomo, or server-side event tracking




Other Information:

Permanent role – 37.5 hours per week between Monday to Friday 9.00 – 5.30pm 
3-month probationary period
Benefits package: 5% Contributory Pension, initial 25 day’s holiday, enhanced maternity/paternity policies, life assurance scheme, Cycle to Work scheme, Employee Assistance Programme, virtual GP and healthcare service

title: Software Engineer (Python)
description:
About the job

About us

At Zego, we know that traditional motor insurance holds good drivers back. It's too complicated, too expensive, and it doesn't take into account how well you actually drive. 

That's why, since 2016, we've been on a mission to change all of that. Our mission at Zego is to offer the lowest priced insurance for good drivers.

From van drivers and gig workers to everyday car drivers, our customers are our driving force — they're at the heart of everything we do.

We've sold tens of millions of policies so far, and raised over $200 million in funding. And we're only just getting started.


About the role

We are seeking a skilled Mid-Level Software Engineer with 2-4 years hands-on experience in software development. You'll ideally have a solid grounding in Python and object-oriented programming, a strong problem-solving mindset, and a passion for writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code. This role focuses on general programming competence over framework expertise, ideal for a developer who thrives in finding solutions to technical challenges.


What you will be doing

Develop, test, and maintain Python code for a variety of applications
Analyse, troubleshoot, and solve complex programming problems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver well-structured solutions
Write clear, concise, and well-documented code that adheres to industry best practices
Contribute to code reviews, offering feedback to ensure code quality across the team
Continuously learn and adapt to new technologies and development practices



About you

2-4 years of experience in Python development (if your primary language isn't Python but you have strong backend experience and are open to working in Python, we'd still love to hear from you!)
Strong understanding of Python fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently on assigned tasks
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git)
Basic knowledge of testing frameworks and a solid approach to debugging and refactoring
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with evolving requirements
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Interest in software optimisation and performance tuning
An understanding of SQL and document databases
Collaborative mindset with excellent communication skills



What's it like to work at Zego?

Joining Zego is a career-defining move. People go further here, reaching their full potential to achieve extraordinary things. 

We're spread throughout the UK and Europe, and united by our drive to get things done. We're proud of our company and our culture - a friendly and inclusive space where we can lift each other up and celebrate our wins every day.

Together, we're setting the bar higher, delivering exceptional work that makes a difference. Our people are the most important part of our story, and everyone here plays a role. There's loads of room to learn and grow, and you'll get the freedom to steer your career wherever you want.

You'll work alongside a talented group who embrace each other's differences and aren't afraid of a challenge. We recognise our achievements, learn from our mistakes, and help each other to be the best we can be. Together, we're making insurance matter. 


How we work

We believe that teams work better when they have time to collaborate and space to get things done. We call it Zego Hybrid. We ask you to spend at least one day a week in our central London office. We think it's a good mix of collaborative face time and flexible home-working, setting us up to achieve the right balance between work and life.


Benefits

We reward our people well. Join us and you'll get a market-competitive salary, private medical insurance, company share options, generous holiday allowance, and a whole lot of wellbeing benefits. And that's just for starters. We also cover the costs for all company-wide events (3 per year), and also provide a separate hybrid contribution to help pay towards other travel costs. 


We're an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

title: Software Engineer
description:
About the job

Software Engineer

Location: Newcastle upon Tyne (Silverlink) - 3 days working onsite, 2 days WFH

Salary: £40,000 - £70,000 depending on experience plus excellent company benefits




You must be a British National to apply for this role, no sponsorship will be given




Our client is seeking talented and motivated C# Software Engineers from mid-level up to Senior level to join their innovative team. In this role, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining cutting-edge cloud-native applications and services. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with the latest technologies and frameworks, contributing to the creation of next-generation, high-performance solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Teams: Work closely with product managers, designers, and developers to gather and analyse requirements, translating them into effective technical solutions.
Develop Cloud-Native Applications: Lead the design, development, testing, and deployment of modern cloud-native web applications and APIs.
Maintain High Standards: Exhibit excellent software craftsmanship, ensuring high-quality and reliable code.
Apply Best Practices: Utilize modern design principles and best practices to produce clean, secure, and maintainable code.
Manage Source Control: Demonstrate proficiency with source control tools such as Git, GitHub, and Azure DevOps, including branching, merging, and pull requests.
Work with Databases: Develop efficient and scalable data storage solutions using PostgreSQL and MS SQL Server.
Embrace DevOps: Participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle, including implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment processes.
Ensure Quality: Conduct comprehensive testing, including unit, integration, and end-to-end tests, to guarantee first-class software quality and reliability.
Stay Informed: Keep up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in cloud-native development.




Requirements for the role:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other developers, to gather and analyse requirements, and translate them into working technical solutions
Be responsible for the design, development, testing, and deployment of modern cloud native web applications and APIs
Demonstrate a high level of software craftsmanship, commitment to quality, and a conscientious approach to work
Utilise modern design principles and best practices to produce, clean, secure and maintainable code
Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of source control tools such as Git, GitHub, and Azure DevOps, as well as the concepts of Branching, Merging and Pull Requests
Be comfortable working with databases, including PostgreSQL and MS SQL Server, to help develop highly efficient and scalable data storage solutions
Have a DevOps mindset, and actively participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle, including the implementation and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment processes
Conduct comprehensive testing, and be comfortable with the concepts of unit, integration, and end-to-end testing, to ensure first class software quality and reliability
Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to cloud native development

 

Essential for this role:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a Software Engineering or a related field
Strong proficiency in the following:
C#, NuGet and XUnit
.NET Core and ASP.NET Core
Visual Studio and VS Code
Source Control (using Git, GitHub and Azure DevOps)
Databases and data storage (using PostgreSQL, MS SQL and Redis)
Containerization (using Docker)
Experience in developing cloud native web applications and APIs
Familiarity with microservices architecture and design patterns
Good understanding of cloud computing concepts and cloud-native development principles
Knowledge of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills

description:
About the job

You’re a great fit for the role if you have:




A good working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
Familiarity with CSS pre-processors such as Sass.
Loads of experience creating responsive user interfaces, particularly replicating modular designs into real life functioning websites.
A great eye for detail - spotting inconsistencies, refining interactions and ensuring the highest level of quality across all deliverables.
Some experience working with content management systems, such as Umbraco or WordPress.
A strong desire to lead technical projects, take initiative and drive development forward beyond just writing code.
An eagerness to actively contribute fresh ideas, make thoughtful suggestions and work closely with UX and design teams to refine and elevate projects.
Comfortable working in fast-paced environments, across multiple projects, and adapting to evolving client needs.
A readiness to learn new techniques, use new approaches and to keep up-to-date with industry advances.
Experience working with Figma (or equivalent e.g., XD), even better if you’ve used them to create UIs yourself.




And some nice to haves:




Experience with Git version control.
Knowledge of PHP and building WordPress themes.
Interaction design understanding, with a passion for usability and accessibility.
Ability to output clean, commented, and team-friendly code.




If you’re ticking the boxes, then it’s probably a good time to let you know the type of person we’re looking for!




Who we’re looking for:




A keen bean – you’ll love planning, plotting, & having ideas that you make a reality.
A curious type – you'll be inquisitive and want to learn new things as you go, particularly all things digital.
An eye for the design detail – you can spot where there’s too much padding from a hundred yards away.
You’re up for some fun – we’re here to enjoy what we do & want you to add to the fun too.
You enjoy getting the little details right – from taking on UX & UI design and functional spec documents, you’ll be the one to help us make sure it’s right first time!




Working at Pretty Pragmatic:




So that’s enough about you, what about us?




We’re Pretty Pragmatic. The marketing agency combining creative flair with deep digital know-how, and the people delivering sensational strategies that just make sense.




We make brands perform, setting the stage for our clients to win over their audiences with charismatic content, outstanding sites, beautiful brands, compelling campaigns, and super search visibility.




We have six internal principles for how we work:




Give & Take – we’re not a rigid 9-5:30 place. We work in real life – if you need to start a bit later or finish early, we can make it work.
Make It Happen – if you have a good idea, don’t be afraid to be the one to make it real.
Basics, Then Brilliance – we do the basics well. Then find ways to go beyond.S
Strive To Stand Out – we like competition. There’s no shame in wanting to be the best.W
Win Together, Lose Apart – we help each other whenever we can. It makes a big difference.P
Pride Over Profit – we stand up for what we believe in, we don’t just bow to a big budget.A




long with this, we offer 25 days holiday and your birthday off – as we all need to enjoy some R&R!W




e also have an annual £500 training allowance per person for your development to make sure you’re continually progressing, insightful masterclasses to share knowledge across the teams, 'Healthy Habits' wellness allowance, pension, Headspace subscription, a week each year where you can ‘work from anywhere’, increasing holidays with tenure, and a range of other PP perks.W




e’re based in Bristol and looking for someone who will be able to work from our lovely studio space in The Paintworks three days a week, two days at home.I




f you’re excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you, email join@prettypragmatic.com with your CV along with a portfolio site if you have one, and we'll be in touch.

title: Software Engineer
description:
About the job

The Company

Luffy AI is an exciting high-tech startup developing adaptive neural networks for industrial control & robotics. Luffy specialises in “Micro AI” controllers that can be trained in simulation on digital twins and successfully transferred into real world systems. The Micro AI controllers can be deployed on existing controller hardware with a small footprint and no internet connection.




Our networks use neural plasticity to learn the dynamics of the equipment they are placed in and continue to adapt long after training. These innovations allow us to overcome the difficulty of applying AI in control system applications.




Our transformational AI technology allows process industries and manufacturers to improve productivity and save energy, and allows industrial automation vendors to simplify and extend the operating envelope of their machines. This revolutionary control technology is a key enabler of Industry 4.0, with huge potential in foundation industries such as metals, glass and cement manufacturing, as well as in automation sectors such as electric motors and robotic systems.




The Role

We are looking for a skilled and experienced Software Engineer to join our multidisciplinary delivery team. The team is responsible for building simulation models, (digital twin simulations), training AI controllers and deploying the developed AI controllers into industrial customer hardware.




As a Software Engineer, your main responsibility is writing clean and efficient code. The ideal candidate has strong tenure building software solutions in Python and at least one compiled language, such as C++, C, C# or Rust.




Key Responsibilities:

Contribute to the design, development and ongoing support of our Simulation Modelling and AI Control software products.
Participate in code reviews to ensure adherence to best practices and high-quality code.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, product managers and other stakeholders to meet customers’ needs.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.
Participate in daily stand-up and regular refinement and planning meetings as part of a team-based, Scrum environment.
Work autonomously and pair up with team members when appropriate.




Required Qualifications and Experience:

Essential

BSc in Computer Science or a related field.
3+ years of experience in a commercial setting as a software engineer.
Commercial experience with Git, continuous integration, and automated testing.
Good understanding of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices.
Comfortable with Python and at least one compiled language
You have worked in collaboration with other developers as a member of an Agile team (preferably Scrum).
Fluent in English with good written and verbal communication skills.




Desirable (bonus points for each of these)

Experience of Industrial Automation and Control Engineering
Experience with ETL / data pipelines
Experience of integrating with technology similar to databricks, PowerBI, Aveva PI
Database schema design
Experience of creating Windows installers
Experience of GUI development







Behaviours and personal characteristics:

Passionate about writing robust, efficient code that is well thought out and tested.
Fast learner, comfortable picking up new technologies and techniques.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.
Product focused, good prioritisation skills.
T-shaped person, deep expertise in a few areas but able to be a generalist when needed.
Team player.
Strong organisational skills.







Benefits:

Full time salary of £45k - £65k, depending on experience and capability assessment during the interview process.
EMI share options scheme.
25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays

title: Full Stack Engineer (React/TypeScript/Node)
description:
About the job

BRAND NEW ROLE – Full Stack Engineer – up to £75K starting salary + bonus + shares – Shoreditch, Hybrid 🏡💻




🛠️Tech Stack Includes:




⚛️ React.js
🔜 Next.js
🟦 TypeScript
🟩 Node.js




💡 Desirable Experience:

🔎 Algolia
🔗 GraphQL
🧠 Headless CMS







This role is for a household name company that has over 6 million followers on social media. 📱🌍




You know what?




It’s a weird one, this one. I usually recruit for big-name brands or fintechs and don’t use the product most of the time. But this one?




I actually use their product—and so do most of my mates... and the Tact office! 👀🙌




They have over a million monthly users across all their platforms. Why do people use it? To learn a new life skill.




You’ll be creating software that actually helps people.




This isn’t your typical dev role. You’d be joining right at the start of a full rebrand. You’ll help build their new app and website from the ground up.




There are two things you don’t get to see when you’re changing jobs: the codebase and the culture. That’s the risk you run, right? 🎭💻




Well...




They are huge on culture—and I mean huge on culture.




For example:




☀️They do “summer hours” and finish at 3:30pm on Fridays from June to August. Most of the dev team will go to the pub after work when they finish early.☀️




They also offer enhanced holidays, flexible hours, unlimited training, private healthcare—the works.




Coding-wise... they have some of the best developers around.




🧠 Some are ex-FAANG.

🚀Some are ex-successful start-up buyout engineers.

🏢Some have worked at household name brands.




(Don't let this put you off if you don't come from the following... The Head of Dev said, "A good dev is a good dev," and can have worked anywhere. As long as they have 3+ years’ experience with React.js, Next.js, TypeScript, and Node.js — we want to speak to them!)




But they’re all talented, collaborative, and part of a “fail first” culture where happy devs make the best code.




If there was ever a role to apply to…

👇

🚀 This. Is. It. 🚀
