title: Junior Full-Stack .Net Software Engineer
description:
About the job

What You'll Be Doing

As part of the strategy around GoComapre's acquisition by Future we're putting in a technology roadmap for re-platforming our domain around an API first, cloud-based serverless architecture to become the leading Price Comparison Website (PCW) service. This is part of our plan to broaden the scope from the GoCompare brand.

As a Junior Software Engineer, you will be an important member of the team building our new systems while also participating in professional development activities to stay current on industry knowledge about the architecture and design. You will work with engineers at all levels to deliver our platform and meet both the customers and our needs.

You will ensure changes are scalable, tested, and developed following best practices, and that we are always improving our codebase.

Reporting to the Tech Lead, you will work with Engineering, Product, UX, QA and Project Management (PMO) teams you will ensure that all applications integrate reliably. You will also learn from the team and other resources to grow your own knowledge and progress as an engineer.

Experience That Will Put You Ahead Of The Curve


Experience with .NET Core or .NET Framework
Experience with JavaScript (ES6+) (TypeScript)
Understanding of cloud technologies such as Azure Services
Experience or awareness of application monitoring practices, such as metrics, tracing and logging
Experience or awareness of testing frameworks (e.g. MS Test, XUnit, Jest, Enzyme, React Testing Library & PlayWright etc.)


What's In It For You

The expected range for this role is £25,000 - £35,000

This is a Hybrid role from either our Bath or Cardiff office, working three days from the office, two from home


 Plus more great perks, which include;
Uncapped leave, because we trust you to manage your workload and time
When we hit our targets, enjoy a share of our profits with a bonus
Refer a friend and get rewarded when they join Future
Wellbeing support with access to our Colleague Assistant Programmes
Opportunity to purchase shares in Future, with our Share Incentive Plan


Internal job family level Technology 7

Who are we...

We're Future, the global leader in specialist media. With over 3,000 employees working across 200+ media brands, Future is a prime destination for passionate people worldwide looking to consume trusted, expert content that educates and inspires action - both online and off - through our specialist websites, magazines, events, newsletters, podcasts and social spaces.

We've got ambitious plans that further build on our growth momentum and unlock new opportunities - and we're looking for driven people who want to be a part of it!

Our Future, Our Responsibility - Inclusion and Diversity at Future

We embrace and celebrate diversity, making it part of who we are.

Different perspectives spark ideas, fuel creativity, and push us to innovate. That's why we're building a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to thrive.

When it comes to hiring, we keep it fair and inclusive, welcoming talent from every walk of life. It's not just about what you bring to the table — it's about making sure the table has room for everyone.

Because a diverse team isn't just good for business. It's the Future.

Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments made so we can give you the best experience!

Find out more about Our Future, Our Responsibility on our website.

title: Software Engineer
description:
About the job

Hyrbid - 1 day per week in office




A growing SaaS organisation is looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer to help shape the future of its modern, cloud-based platform. This is an exciting opportunity to join a forward-thinking company delivering innovative solutions to a specialised industry.




About the Role




As a key member of the development team, you’ll design, build, and maintain robust, scalable applications. You’ll contribute directly to the evolution of the company’s flagship platform, helping meet the complex needs of its customers. This is a permanent, full-time, remote position, with travel to the Glasgow office once per quarter.




What You’ll Do




Write clean, maintainable code using Agile and Test Driven Development (TDD) practices.
Develop deep understanding of customer use-cases and domain-specific challenges.
Translate business requirements into well-architected software solutions.
Collaborate with Business Analysts and QA Engineers in requirement and design sessions.
Write and optimise complex queries, views, triggers, and functions for relational databases.
Participate in code reviews and pair programming sessions.
Analyse and evaluate the impact of changes across systems and infrastructure.
Document software for maintainability and operational handover.
Support production deployments and provide third-level support during business hours.




What We’re Looking For

Strong experience in professional software development, ideally with C# or Java.
Proficiency with modern JavaScript frameworks such as VueJS, React, Angular, or Blazor WebAssembly.
Familiarity with Agile development and modern DevOps practices.
A degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering (or equivalent professional experience).
Experience writing automated tests (e.g., NUnit, Jest).
Knowledge of both relational and non-relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cosmos DB).




About the Organisation




This SaaS company delivers a cloud-based platform supporting clients in a high-impact, research-driven sector. Their solution streamlines critical business operations for their customers, allowing them to focus on their core work. The development team is committed to staying ahead of the curve, continuously evolving the platform with cutting-edge technology.




What’s In It for You?




A supportive and entrepreneurial environment where innovation is encouraged.
A strong culture focused on collaboration, learning, and continuous improvement.
A competitive package with a comprehensive range of employee benefits.




Excited to make an impact in a tech-forward SaaS environment? Let’s chat!

title: AI Growth Hacker
description:
About the job

We’re looking for a sharp and scrappy AI Growth Hacker to bring ambitious growth and automation ideas to life at BlckBx. You'll work directly with the CEO and across each department to co-create and execute smart, tech-enabled growth solutions that drive real impact — fast.




You’ll contribute to shaping the "what" and the "why" behind automation and growth experiments — starting off across marketing and sales and then into operations, applying structured thinking to identify where AI and technology can unlock speed, efficiency, or scale. Once an idea is clear, you’ll take full ownership of making it happen end to end — using AI tools like Replit, Make, Prosp.ai, Kleo.so, Phantomwriter, Higsfield.ai, ChatGPT etc as well as traditional tools such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, MailChimp and Hubspot and internal systems to build, test, and iterate rapidly.




This role is for someone who thrives in ideation and execution together — a builder who can think and a thinker who ships - it’s a combination of creativity and science.




You’ll need to be comfortable with code, data and reporting metrics.




Skills needed:

No previous marketing or sales experience needed.
Strong familiarity with AI and automation tools — Replit, Lovable, ChatGPT, Zapier/Make, etc.
Basic working knowledge of Python is a plus — enough to adapt and run existing scripts




How to get an interview:

Email a cover email to hello@blckbx.co.uk with why you'd be great at this job and give some examples of what you've built using AI tools.




How you’ll get the role:

You’ll need to show us the tools you can use and your thought process by creating real solutions we need over an hour’s interview.




Where we’re based:

Our office will be moving to Reading (on Elizabeth line) but is currently in Bracknell (RG42) near the train station. You will come to the office 2-3 times a week.




What BlckBx does:

BlckBx is the leading AI + Human personal assistant service for professionals. See https://blckbx.co.uk/




What will be your remuneration:

We’re offering £35k + £5k equity (employee options), moving up to £40k after the first 3 months. There will be a clear fast track through the business.

title: Data Engineer (Snowflake)
description:
About the job

Data Engineer (Snowflake) - Nationwide Charity
 
 Location: London-based (Hybrid - 1 day per week in the office)
 
 Contract: FTC - 23 months
 
£56,500
 
Overview:
 
We are currently recruiting on behalf of a well-established nationwide charity for a Snowflake Data Engineer. This is an exciting opportunity to play a key role in designing and developing data products and services that improve how data is accessed and used across the organisation. You'll help ensure data is accurate, timely, and fit for purpose, supporting a wide range of departments and strategic goals.
 
Role Summary:
 
As a Data Engineer, you will work to connect systems, streamline business processes, and optimise data warehouse platforms. You'll collaborate with stakeholders to deliver bespoke BI solutions, ranging from custom queries to dashboards and reports. Your work will transform raw data into actionable insights that drive the charity's mission forward.
 
In addition to building and maintaining data integration pipelines, you'll help ensure the ongoing performance and reliability of the charity's core data platforms, which include Snowflake, and Tableau.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 

Design, build, and manage APIs and data pipelines, enabling smooth data flow between systems including websites and Salesforce.
Develop and maintain data ingestion, storage, and visualisation tools to support organisation-wide reporting and analytics.
Collaborate with external providers to enable data integration across third-party platforms and partners.
Build dashboards and visual reports to convey KPIs and other metrics tailored to stakeholder needs.
Ensure all components of the data architecture are up to date, well-maintained, and aligned with best practices.
Document data flows, including data sources, transformations, destinations, and schedules for improved transparency and governance.
Evaluate, recommend, and implement BI tools and reporting solutions, balancing technical and user needs.
Support and enhance existing analytics tools to ensure ongoing suitability and performance.

Key Skills & Experience (Essential):
 

Proven experience in Data Engineering, particularly with Snowflake.
Strong experience in data integration and business intelligence development.
Proficient in SQL, Python, and R.
Skilled in using BI and data visualisation tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
Familiar with Agile (Scrum) methodologies and collaboration tools like the Atlassian suite.
Experience developing canonical data models and managing APIs and associated tools.
Strong organisational and multitasking skills, with the ability to adapt to shifting priorities.

Desirable:
 

Certifications in data engineering, analytics, or related platforms (e.g. IBM Data Engineering, Google Professional Data Engineering, SnowPro, Tableau).
Experience with data modelling tools such as Erwin or ER/Studio.
Prior experience working within the not-for-profit or charity sector.

Additional Information:
 

The role is based in London, with hybrid working of 1 day per week in the office.
Occasional travel may be required to other UK or Ireland locations.
Salary: £56,500 per annum. Benefits - 26 days holiday rising annually, Perkbox, Life Assurance, Pension from 9% to 16%, BUPA Dental

Morgan Hunt is an equal opportunities employer. Job suitability is assessed on merit in accordance with the individual's skills, qualifications and abilities to perform the relevant duties required in a particular role.

title: Junior Customer Projects Engineer
description:
About the job

Be part of an organisation that is passionate about saving lives by providing the best safety solutions.




Fortress Safety is a rapidly growing organisation, headquartered in Wolverhampton, UK. Due to our ambitious growth plans, we are on the lookout for an experienced and ambitious Junior Customer Projects Engineer.




As Junior Customer Projects Engineer at Fortress Safety you will have a great development opportunity to use your knowledge and gain broad experience in a successful manufacturing company. With a tremendous track record of growth and part of the highly successful Halma group, Fortress provides you an unrivalled combination of broad engineering experience and opportunities for future development.




You will have to opportunity to:




Create bespoke product designs and configurations for Fortress’ customers including creation of dimensional product drawings and wiring diagrams for product installation and use.
Create wiring diagrams and assembly drawings or instructions for Fortress’ manufacturing team.
Create and maintain product BOMs and Routings within Fortress ERP system.
Carry out small product design and development projects, assisting NPD and Manufacturing Engineering teams.
Assist the Technical Support team with customer queries




Essential Requirements 

Degree or similar qualification in Mechanical Design Engineering or comparable subject.
Experience in 3D CAD software CREO and Windchill (other similar CAD software will be considered).
Ability to accurately read, layout and create 2D Engineering drawings.
Understanding of geometric tolerances and other similar Engineering principles.
Experience or understanding of ERP software(s) (Microsoft Navision preferred).




Desirable Requirements

Understanding of basic Electronics and Mechatronic principles to aid in creation of wiring diagrams and drawings.
Experience of hands-on approach to product testing.




You will set the standard when it comes to driving improvements to enhance our customer experience.




If all of this sounds exciting to you, please apply today!

title: Data Entry Clark
description:
About the job

We’re looking for a Data Entry Clerk to join our dedicated Customs team—a sharp, detail-oriented individual ready to play a key role in the fast-paced world of international freight forwarding. This is a permanent role offering the flexibility of a hybrid working model, where you’ll spend 3 days per week at our head office in Bradford (BD12). In return, we offer a competitive salary of £26,208 along with a with a structured development plan, offering training, mentorship, and growth opportunities.




You’ll be part of a crucial team, that keeps global trade running smoothly, entering and managing critical customs data to ensure shipments cross borders without delays - supporting import and export operations for everything from high-tech gear to essential goods.




What will you be doing as our Data Entry Clerk:

Accurately input import and export data into customs and our internal WMS systems
Prepare and process customs documentation including invoices, packing lists, and bills of lading
Monitor shipment status and proactively resolve data discrepancies or document issues
Communicate with freight forwarders, customs brokers, and internal departments to coordinate documentation
Maintain accurate and organised records of all shipments and transactions
Ensure compliance with customs regulations, tariff codes, and trade agreements
Perform general clerical duties supporting the export administrator including filing, scanning, and email correspondence




What we need from our Data Entry Clerk:

Experienced in data entry with strong attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills with a team-oriented attitude
Confident with using Microsoft packages in particular Excel
Understand of Customs software would be desirable but not essential




About Us:

Advanced Supply Chain Group offer a complete end-to-end supply chain service, from source to shelf, covering all aspects of supply chain management, global logistics, fulfilment, and value-added services, allowing our customers to maximise the opportunities that exist in today’s technology-enabled marketplace. Using our unique intelligent supply chain model, we design innovative solutions to complex challenges, unlock new opportunities, and speed up and streamline existing processes by removing complexity from the supply chain. It all adds up to providing a service that is “Better, Faster, Cheaper” than our competitors.

title: Procurement Compliance Coordinator
description:
About the job

Discover BSR:

British Solar Renewables creates smart energy systems for a net zero carbon future. British Solar Renewables develops (BSR Energy), builds (BSR EPC), and maintains (BSR O&M) utility-scale solar, wind and storage projects in the UK and internationally. Having developed and built in excess of 700MWp BSR are a major contributor to the UK Renewable Energy Sector.




What we offer:

We’re building a community of passionate individuals committed to shaping the future; providing the chance to work on cutting-edge projects in the renewable energy sector. Offering a culture where collaboration and inclusivity thrive alongside opportunities for professional growth and development. Join a team making a real difference. 




About this role: 

The Procurement Department are responsible for all purchasing, hire and supply contracts across the BSR Group of companies. From central office requirements to multiple high value materials required for construction and maintenance in the UK. 




The Procurement Compliance Coordinator will be primarily responsible for improving and developing sustainable procurement processes that align with the Procurement Team and wider business. With further administrative responsibilities such as maintaining data and producing reports. 




What we need from you: 

Develop and improve sustainable procurement processes incorporating analysis and supply chain mapping 
Onboarding of suppliers to EcoVadis, and implement action plans for future assessments in line with company expectation 
Review EcoVadis Annual Maturity Review and assist in setting objectives for the procurement team and wider business, implementing action plans to improve or maintain our current ratings 
Attend meetings and webinars as required (Solar Energy UK Steering Group, Solar Stewardship Initiative, Supply Chain Sustainability School) in person or remotely 
Implement training for new starters and across the wider business to ensure a broad understanding of the issues relating to sustainable procurement 
Engage with third party Responsible Business Alliance accredited auditors, to instruct audits and coordinate action plans, in line with company expectations 
Develop and maintain materials for use at external events to support the wider business. 
Assist in compiling reports & presentations 
Remain updated on current and future regulations (CSRD, CSDDD, CBAM), issues, news, relating to the industry, providing timely feedback when relevant to ensure compliance 
Work with our suppliers to continually improve their ESG standards to meet the expectations of the business 
Other ad hoc duties as required. 




What skills you will have: 

Experience in a similar role is desirable; however, training will be provided for the right candidate. 
A genuine interest in the renewable energy sector 
Understanding of ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) practices is desirable. 
Strong multitasking abilities, with a history of managing multiple priorities in fast-paced environments. 
Exceptional organisational and administrative skills, with a keen eye for detail. 
Highly effective at prioritising and planning tasks throughout the working day, ensuring optimal productivity and outcomes. 
Ability to work independently, showing initiative and taking ownership, as well as contributing collaboratively within a team. 




What you will get from BSR: 

Monthly social events, such as team lunches, breakfasts, volunteering and a Christmas and Summer party. 
Our Hybrid Working Policy allows you to work from home up to three days a week. 
Enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption policies. 
An annual bonus scheme which rewards you for all of your hard work. 
A referral scheme for when you refer someone to work at BSR. 
Supporting you beyond work with our Employee Assistance Programme offering 24/7 support. 
BSR will fund one professional membership per annum. 
25 days of annual leave, plus bank holidays, with the option to roll over up to 5 days. 
Long Service Recognition Scheme
Private Health insurance after completion of 3-month probation period. 
Life insurance
Pension




Closing Date: Monday 26th May at 12 noon




Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women are less likely to apply for a role unless they meet 100% of the role requirements. At BSR, we are committed to equal opportunities in employment, if you are interested in one our positions, we encourage you to apply. 

 

Our hiring decisions are not just about technical skills; but also about finding individuals whose values, work ethic, and personality would make a great addition to our team. 

 

If you need reasonable adjustments for the interview process, contact us at recruitment@britishrenewables.com

 

We encourage candidates to apply promptly. This advert may close early if we receive a high volume of applications.

title: Health Economist
description:
About the job

Senior Health Economist – Modelling Focus

Award-winning Market Access & HEOR Consultancy

Permanent | Excellent salary & benefits package




Are you a skilled health economist with a strong foundation in economic modelling? Do you thrive on solving complex challenges through intuitive, evidence-driven solutions? If so, this could be the ideal next step in your career.




We are working with a leading, award-winning Market Access consultancy known for its scientific excellence, creativity, and commitment to delivering meaningful impact in healthcare. As they continue to grow, they are seeking a Senior Health Economist with deep experience in health economic modelling to join their highly regarded team.




The Company

This is a consultancy that blends scientific rigour with creative thinking. They are renowned for developing health economic and market access solutions that genuinely influence real-world healthcare decisions and improve patient access to innovation – whether that’s pharmaceuticals, diagnostics, medical devices, or healthcare services.




You’ll join a passionate, intelligent, and supportive team of HEOR professionals who take pride in their work and the positive impact it creates. The company offers a collaborative culture, exceptional opportunities for career progression, flexible working, and a genuine commitment to work–life balance.




The Modelling Team

Their Health Economics Modelling team is at the forefront of model innovation, sought out by clients specifically for their expertise. Whether adapting existing models or developing new ones from scratch, they translate complex clinical and economic data into clear, actionable insights. Their modelling portfolio spans:

Cost-effectiveness models (early, global, HTA submissions)
Budget impact models
Pricing and reimbursement models
Markov and individual patient-level simulations
Natural history and disease transmission models
Complex simulation models
National/local model adaptations and reviews




The Role

As a Senior Health Economist, you’ll play a pivotal role in the development and delivery of high-quality health economic models across a wide range of therapy areas. You’ll also lead project teams, support client engagements, and contribute to business growth through thought leadership and mentorship.




Key responsibilities include:

Leading the conceptualisation, design, development, and validation of economic models
Acting as a technical lead on modelling tasks, both independently and collaboratively
Managing delivery of models, technical documentation, and user guides
Providing training to clients and mentoring junior team members
Driving quality assurance and scientific rigour across deliverables
Supporting proposal development, client pitches, and business development
Contributing to publications and presenting modelling work externally
Supporting internal learning and development initiatives




About You

To be successful in this role, you’ll bring:

A degree in a relevant scientific or healthcare discipline (postgraduate qualifications desirable)
Significant experience in health economic modelling within a consultancy or industry HEOR setting
A strong technical skill set, particularly in Excel/VBA; experience in R or other modelling tools is a plus
Proven experience managing complex technical projects and client relationships
A collaborative mindset with mentoring and/or line management experience
A genuine enthusiasm for developing models that support market access and HTA strategy
You’ll report to the Principal Health Economist and may have line management responsibilities for junior health economists.




What’s on Offer?

A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package
Flexible, hybrid working options
Opportunities for rapid progression in a growing business
A dynamic, supportive, and science-led culture
The chance to shape real-world healthcare decisions through high-impact modelling work




If you’re passionate about modelling, driven by quality, and ready to take the next step in your health economics career – we’d love to hear from you.




Please get in touch for a confidential discussion or to apply.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
About the job

Are you passionate about creating intuitive, engaging digital experiences?

Do you thrive at the intersection of design, usability, and technology?

Would you like to play a key role in shaping the look and feel of a web-based product used by thousands of users daily?




My client is seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join their team and take ownership of the end-to-end design process for a scalable, web-based product. This is a hands-on role that combines user research, interaction design, and visual design. You'll work closely with product managers and developers to bring concepts to life and ensure every user journey is frictionless, accessible, and visually polished.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead the design of user interfaces for new features and product enhancements.
Conduct user research, usability testing, and interviews to deeply understand user needs.
Create wireframes, prototypes, user flows, and high-fidelity mockups using industry-standard tools (e.g., Figma, Adobe XD).

3+ years’ experience in a UI/UX design role, ideally working on web-based applications.

Ability to work independently and communicate clearly with developers and non-design stakeholders.

Desirable (but not essential):

Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments.

What’s on Offer:

title: Full Stack Engineer, Graduate/Junior Level (Must be UK)
description:
About the job

PolyAI automates customer service through lifelike voice assistants that let customers lead a conversation. Our voice assistants make it possible for businesses to deliver outstanding customer service that rivals their human agents. Our customers, which include the world’s leading logos, are expanding how they use our platform, driving automation of critical customer service operations and integrating PolyAI into their daily customer service workflows.

We're on the lookout for a Full Stack Software Engineer based in the United Kingdom to join our tech team and play a key role in crafting user-friendly voice experiences. We are open to graduates with commercial internship experience to Mid-Level Engineers.

In this role, you'll be responsible for the development of our in-house voice stack, helping develop both front-end features on our user-facing platform as well as internal tooling.

Collaborating with a diverse engineering team, you'll contribute to a cohesive and scalable codebase. Your focus includes implementing new features on our platform. If you're passionate about technology, enjoy tackling challenges, and are eager to contribute to our friendly, innovative environment, we'd love to welcome you aboard!

Minimum Qualifications


1-2 years professional working experience in a full stack development role within a Technical Business or SaaS company
Hands-on experience in designing, deploying, and maintaining RESTful APIs
Proficient working ability with Python, React, and Typescript or Javascript 
Working proficiency in verbal and written English
Bachelor’s degree or Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering, a relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience


Your Responsibilities Will Involve


Building and maintaining internal tools which allow speedy data annotation and curation for training machine learning models, as well as admin panels for observability and rollouts of critical pipeline changes.
Help contributing to our user-facing platform for building and configuring voice assistants, particularly
Working alongside our Senior Engineers and always looking to learn more 
Contributing to the implementation of our multi-tenant infrastructure, across multiple cloud vendors.
Playing a part in our software development, through writing code, tests, as well as contributing to design ideas, documents and performing code reviews


Preferred Qualifications 


Experience with one or more cloud services: AWS, GCP, Azure
Understanding of algorithms, data structures, system design and complexity analysis
A degree or interest in applied machine learning, supercharging teams by building internal tools
Finds enjoyment in technical challenges and wants to contribute directly to solutions in a start-up environment.

Benefits

💰 Participation in the company’s employee share options plan

🏝 25 days holiday, plus bank holidays

🏡 Flexible working from home policy

🌎 Work from outside of the UK for up to 6 months each year

🧡 Enhanced parental leave

🚲 Bike2Work scheme

📚 Annual learning and development allowance

🏡 One-off WFH allowance when you join

👨‍👩‍👧 Company-funded fertility and family-forming programmes

🌸 Menopause care programme with Maven

🏥 Private healthcare and dental cover, discounts on gym members and relaxation apps, and access to a range of mental health programs

At PolyAI, we take great pride in our values—they guide everything we do. We believe that a strong culture leads to meaningful work and lasting impact.

Our Core Values Are


Only the best: We expect the best from our people, we hire people that expect the best from themselves, and we nurture this drive for excellence. 
Ownership: We care deeply about what we do. We take ownership of our initiatives, decisions and outcomes. 
Relentlessly improve: We demand more from ourselves and are always evolving. Continuous, obsessive improvement is the only way we will transform the world of conversational AI. 
Bias for action: Our world moves quickly and so do we. We take calculated risks and we deliver impact fast. 
Disagree and commit: We are all working toward the same goal. If we donʼt agree with something, we work hard to understand it and when a decision is made, we accept it and give it our all. 
Build for people: We are hyper-focused on delivering the best automated experiences possible so that we can empower people to get exactly what they need, when they need it. 


PolyAI is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions at PolyAI will be based on the business needs without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, neurodiversity status or disability status.

Kindly find the Privacy Notice for our recruitment process by following the link here. This document provides important information regarding how we handle your personal data throughout the recruitment journey.

title: Applied Scientist
description:
About the job

Job Title: Applied Scientist (Full Time)




Location: Harwell Science Campus (near Oxford) preferred, Cornwall Office (near Penryn) possible. Remote work available, but applicants must be able to reach a designated office.




Working Hours: 37 hours per week, with flexible hours possible.




Salary: £60-80k (dependent on experience)




Benefits:




25 days holiday per annum, plus UK Bank Holidays (with up to 5-day rollover)
Company pension
Private medical insurance
Flexible remote working




Why Join Aspia?




Aspia combines the freedom and creativity of a research lab with the commercial urgency of a high-growth start-up. Our approach is already powering breakthrough solutions in land use, climate resilience, and food security. We’re looking for exceptional individuals who can thrive in a fast-moving, research-driven, but product-focused environment.




About Aspia




Aspia Space is building the next generation of planetary intelligence. We transform observational data into trusted, consumable intelligence for agriculture, finance, environmental planning and policy.




From our offices in Harwell and Cornwall, we push Earth data to its limits to deliver insights no one else can, developing products that combine satellite imagery and expert ground truth with the very best observational science and deep learning tools to support clients across the world, powering everything from smallholder farming programmes in Africa to biodiversity net gain compliance in the UK.




We’re a multidisciplinary team of scientists, engineers, and product strategists who believe in delivering practical impact. Our ambition is global, but our focus is always local, measurable, and relevant.




About the Role




We are looking for an Applied Scientist with an engineering mindset and a strong foundation in data science. You will be part of a small, agile R&D team applying advanced machine learning techniques to satellite Earth Observation data. You will collaborate with experienced scientists and engineers, with opportunities to mentor and be mentored.




You should be comfortable handling large (and small) datasets and eager to reframe complex technical problems as opportunities for innovation. Scientific rigour and curiosity are essential: we value critical thinking and a hands-on approach to solving problems that don’t have textbook answers.




This is not a conventional industry role. We are interested in boundary-crossers—people who draw from multiple disciplines, who can translate ideas into robust, scalable code, and who are able to effectively communicate their ideas and results to others, including non-technical stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities




Be an integral part of the R&D team, contributing to the development of new and existing EO-based products and services.
Apply deep learning models (such as U-Nets, transformers, diffusion models) to EO data. 
Lead or contribute to experimental research projects, including proof-of-concepts and rapid prototyping, either in response to external requests/challenges or brainstormed within the team. These may be associated with short deadlines or be more open-ended.
Document code, maintain version control, and follow good software engineering practices.
Contribute to technical reports, whitepapers and academic articles related to Aspia Space research and product development.
Shape Aspia's R&D roadmap through idea generation and exploration of new methodologies.
Represent Aspia at internal and external meetings, workshops, conferences, and trade shows.
Support grant writing and proposal development.




Required Qualifications & Experience




At least a 2.1 undergraduate degree in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another numerate discipline, or an exceptional non-traditional background (e.g. open-source contributions).
A postgraduate degree (MSc, MRes or PhD) in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other numerate discipline.
Commercial or industry experience with a strong coding component.
Solid understanding of applied statistics.
Experience with scalable deep learning techniques and large EO data. We are particularly interested in candidates who have a history of successfully applying neural networks in the real world.
Fluency in Python and common data science libraries (NumPy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn, Jupyter, PyTorch).
Proficiency with Linux, bash scripting, and git.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical material to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team.
Ability to plan work and meet deadlines.




Desirable Skills & Experience




Experience with geospatial data and tools (such as QGIS, geopandas, rasterio).
A well-maintained GitHub or GitLab portfolio.
Familiarity with cloud computing (AWS, Azure, GCP) or HPC environments.
Experience of working in an Agile environment.
Evidence of leading independent research.
A publication record in peer-reviewed literature or notable conferences.




How To Apply




To apply, please send a PDF of your CV (and an optional cover letter) to Laura Botha at laura.botha@aspiaspace.com. Informal enquiries can be directed to James Geach at james.geach@aspiaspace.com.




Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

title: Founder's Associate
description:
About the job

About RefNow 

RefNow is on a mission to revolutionise the way employment history data is collected and 

shared. Our platform is the #1 most rated employment referencing system for HR teams and 

recruiters, trusted by companies across the globe. We believe referencing should be fast, 

secure, and candidate-friendly - and we’re building the hiring platform of the future to make

Founded by a team passionate about technology and the future of work, RefNow has grown 

rapidly and continues to innovate. We leverage AI to streamline the referencing process and 

are always exploring new and better ways to improve efficiency, accuracy, and the overall 

experience for both employers and candidates to collate as many valuable insights as 

possible. 




The Role 

We’re looking for a sharp, driven, and entrepreneurial Founders’ Associate to work directly 

with the co-founders and leadership team. This role is a hybrid of strategic support, 

operations, and executive assistance - ideal for someone who wants to gain exposure 

across all areas of a high-growth SaaS startup and be part of key operations at the highest 

level. 




You’ll have your hands in product, operations, finance, marketing, and customer success - 

and no two days will be the same.

title: Naval Architect
description:

title: Power Systems R&D Engineer
description:
About the job

Company Description:

Camlin is a global technology leader that operates with the vision of bringing revolutionary products to life for a wide range of industries, including power and rail, and also has interests in a number of R&D projects in a variety of scientific sectors.




At Camlin we believe in high quality engineering and design, allowing us to develop market leading products and services. In short, we love creating value for our customers by solving difficult problems. As of today, the Camlin operation spans over 20 countries across the globe.




As a Power Systems Research and Development Engineer in Camlin, you will work within a multi-disciplinary team of electrical and software engineers, and data scientists to deliver innovative solutions to support distribution network operators’ (DNOs) business needs. You will study the network behaviour in detail, and develop and implement novel solutions to, for example, identify and diagnose issues on the network, or optimise capacity in the network assets.




Responsibilities

Create, validate and maintain power systems network models, alongside documentation of associated methodologies, where required.
Design, develop, document and test robust, efficient and novel algorithms to meet project requirements, consulting appropriate literature when required.
Analyse field data to validate, troubleshoot and enhance the models and algorithms.
Act as a subject matter expert on UK distribution power systems within multidisciplinary project teams.
Communicate methodologies clearly to the teams responsible for their implementation.
Manage time and priorities across projects, notify stakeholders of progress against plans and adapt readily to dynamic business priorities




Essential Criteria: 

Degree in Electrical Power Systems/Electrical/Electronic Engineering or equivalent numerate discipline.
Strong understanding of electric power distribution, electrical load behaviours, and the modelling of time-series demand/distributed generation patterns.
Experience of performing steady-state and/or transient power systems studies, e.g. load flow, short-circuit fault analysis and/or switching studies.
Strong and proven numerical analysis skills, engineering mathematics and statistics.
Proven ability to solve complex problems using creative solutions.




Benefits:

Competitive salary
Company Pension & Life Assurance Schemes
On-site parking
Hybrid Working
Subsidised Gym Membership




EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Individuals seeking employment at Camlin are considered without regards to race, colour, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

title: Building Inspector
description:
About the job

People are at the heart of our business, we pride ourselves as being an employer of choice, making our employees a priority to best ensure work-life balance, flexibility where possible and promote continuous training and development for all. The Registered Building Inspector will be joining us at an amazing and exciting time of development and growth and will contribute significantly to the profitable long-term growth of the business and advocate the values / culture of the business.

Responsible for the day-to-day project management of multiple projects, ensuring, as far as practicable, compliance with building regulations and associated standards of construction projects and / or conversion project.

Recording and maintaining accurate inspection records
Managing relationships with customers to promote business development

Keen eye for detail and process orientated

Will have good communication and interpersonal skills
Commercial awareness

title: Building Technology Graduate Data Analyst
description:
About the job

About The Role

In this role, you'll be responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting data from a variety of sources. You'll develop clear and insightful reports, collaborate with various departments, and contribute to data-driven initiatives that align with our business objectives.

Success in this role requires a high level of analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and technical proficiency in tools such as SQL, Excel, Power BI or Tableau. You should be comfortable managing multiple priorities, maintaining accuracy under pressure, and continuously adapting to new data technologies and methodologies.

What Matters Most In This Role

Your primary focus will be on ensuring the accuracy and completeness of data collected from various sources. By delivering high-quality analysis and insightful dashboards, you'll empower teams across the business to make informed, data-driven decisions.

You'll work closely with colleagues across different departments, contributing to shared projects and aligning analytics with broader business goals. Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset will be essential for success.

In a rapidly evolving data landscape, staying current with industry best practices is key. A passion for learning and a proactive approach to new tools, especially in analytics and business intelligence, will help you thrive in this role.

Other duties will include:


Gathering and Processing data from multiple sources
Analysing large datasets to identify trends and support strategic decisions
Creating interactive dashboards and reports to improve accessibility of data
Collaborating on cross functional projects and business initiatives
Staying informed about emerging tools, techniques and trends in data analytics
Supporting data quality assurance processes and resolving data-related issues


Salary Band £30,000 - £45,000

What We Expect From You

We're looking for someone with strong time management and organisational skills who can work effectively both independently and within a team. You should be comfortable juggling multiple projects, prioritising tasks, and responding to challenges with creative, analytical solutions.

You'll bring proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau, with bonus points for experience in Python or R. A keen eye for detail, a passion for data, and an interest in the commercial property industry will be key to your success in this role.

WHY Workman?

Hybrid working to offer you a great work life balance, with a minimum of three days in the office.

Core working hours to allow for added flexibility and helps ease your commute to the office.

Study support

Discretionary annual bonus and salary reviews.

Healthcare, life insurance & wellness programme.

Long service additional holidays, your birthday off and an extra day between Christmas and New Year

Lifestyle benefits to suit you: gym membership, cycle to work, buy and sell holiday to name just a few.

Social events throughout the year including a firm wide Christmas party!

Generous referral bonus.

ABOUT Workman LLP

As the UK's leading independent commercial property management specialist, Workman has an enviable position within the property industry.

We are proud of our longstanding relationships with many of our clients, some of whom we have worked with for more than 25 years. Our clients include leading institutional and sector-specialist investors, private property companies, public sector bodies and a growing number of overseas investors.

We pride ourselves on the caliber of our employees and their unique skill sets.

For more information on working for Workman please visit

Our People | Workman LLP

EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

We are an equal opportunities employer, and it is our policy is to recruit a diverse workforce and follow the guidelines of the Equality Act 2010

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
About the job

Overview

We’re looking for a talented and motivated Full Stack Developer to join our growing team. You’ll be working on end-to-end web application development, with a strong emphasis on building clean, responsive user interfaces using React and Material UI, as well as developing robust, secure APIs with .NET and C#.

The role is full-time, remote/hybrid and working from home or at our Stafford office (ST16 2LP).

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications using React as the core front-end framework.
Build responsive, pixel-perfect user interfaces using Material UI and Bootstrap, based on design mock-ups and UX guidelines.
Develop and document RESTful APIs using .NET and C#, leveraging ORM frameworks like Entity Framework and Dapper for efficient, secure data access.
Implement authentication and authorization workflows using identity providers such as Auth0 and Microsoft Entra ID.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including design, QA, and data engineering to deliver cohesive, high-quality features.
Participate in code reviews, uphold best practices, and contribute to continuous improvement of the codebase.
Support the full software development lifecycle including testing, deployment, and monitoring in Microsoft Azure environments.

Required Skills & Experience

Expertise building modern web applications with React.
Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, and C#.
Strong experience with UI component libraries such as Material UI and Bootstrap.
Proven experience designing and consuming RESTful APIs.
Solid understanding of CRUD operations, relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., SQL, CosmosDB).
Practical experience with data validation, input sanitization, and robust error handling.
Proficient with Swagger/OpenAPI for API documentation and testing.
Experience integrating authentication providers like Auth0 or Entra ID.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps workflows using tools like GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps.
Hands-on experience deploying and managing applications in Microsoft Azure.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: £45,000.00-£55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Work from home

Schedule:

Monday to Friday
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Stafford ST16 2LP

title: Information Technology System Administrator
description:
About the job

Are you ready to play a pivotal role in delivering and improving IT services within a dynamic business environment? We are seeking a skilled IT System Administrator to provide comprehensive support across our clients organisation, ensuring delivery of reliable and effective IT services.




Key Responsibilities

Manage routine repairs, upgrades and effectively respond to system faults or failures, ensuring these are documented and escalated appropriately.
Keep the asset management database accurate and up to date.
Monitor system performance and report on service delivery metrics, exploring opportunities to improve customer satisfaction.
Support the management and maintenance of distributed IT equipment and infrastructure, ensuring it meets evolving business requirements.
Log and update service desk calls promptly, ensuring regular, clear communication with users.
Provide meeting room technology support and education for end users.
Ensure adherence to IT service controls, regulatory standards, and organisational policies.
Collaborate with all IT teams to ensure the successful implementation and documentation of new or updated services.
Undertake ad hoc projects and departmental duties as required.




Essential Skills and Experience

Excellent customer service skills and a drive to satisfy IT service users.
Ability to translate complex technical topics into clear, accessible language.
Strong decision-making skills, with a focus on developing timely and effective solutions.
Meticulous attention to detail and a continuous improvement mindset.
Analytical skills for diagnosing, testing, and implementing solutions in line with best practice.
Ability to prioritise workload and manage multiple demands in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.




Technical Proficiency

Detailed knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory and Entra.
Experience in group policy implementation and administration.
Proven track record with IT systems, infrastructure, and emerging technologies.
Network management (including TCP/IP, DNS), server/hardware maintenance, and workstation deployment.
Familiarity with automated deployment tools and IT service management frameworks.




Your Approach

We’re looking for someone who:

Puts customers at the centre of every decision.
Collaborates willingly and takes ownership for results.
Learns from mistakes and celebrates success.
Shares relevant feedback and supports team growth.
Understands and manages operational and regulatory risk, following all company policies and procedures.

title: Dialogue Designer
description:
About the job

PolyAI automates customer service through lifelike voice assistants that let customers lead a conversation. Our voice assistants make it possible for businesses to deliver outstanding customer service that rivals their human agents. Our customers, which include the world’s leading logos, are expanding how they use our platform, driving automation of critical customer service operations and integrating PolyAI into their daily customer service workflows.

PolyAI are on the hunt for exceptional Dialogue Designers! This role is suited to those who want to be accountable and influential. And for those who want their words to be spoken to millions of customers of global brands.

Responsibilities


 This role is suitable for someone who is looking to start their career! New Graduates welcome 
 Designing the customer experience of virtual assistants, from simple FAQ answers to long and complex conversations 
 Helping build and maintain virtual assistants both using internal tools and Python 
 Obsessing over metrics to assess performance and customer satisfaction — making sure everything you do is measurable and having a big impact 
 Listening to how real customers interact with your designs, and prioritising the right things to make each call even better 
 Helping our engineering team ensure that our implementations of Generative AI are effective, accurate, and safe 


Minimum Requirements:


 A fixation on good user experience, you are meticulous and have an eye for detail 
 Ability to explain and distil complex ideas and user flows using clear, plain, supportive, inclusive language 
 Interest in natural language understanding and conversational AI 
 Experience with Python 
 Some knowledge or aptitude for analytics or data science 


Qualifications:


 BS/MS degree in Interaction Design, Linguistics or another Social Science field 
 Experience managing both internal and external stakeholders through various stages of content development 
 Experience with NLU technology 
 Experience with data manipulation, data analytics, and visualisation


Benefits

💰 Participation in the company’s employee share options plan

🏝 25 days holiday, plus bank holidays

🏡 Flexible working from home policy

🌎 Work from outside of the UK for up to 6 months each year

🧡 Enhanced parental leave

🚲 Bike2Work scheme

📚 Annual learning and development allowance

🏡 One-off WFH allowance when you join

👨‍👩‍👧 Company-funded fertility and family-forming programmes

🌸 Menopause care programme with Maven

🏥 Private healthcare and dental cover, discounts on gym members and relaxation apps, and access to a range of mental health programs

At PolyAI, we take great pride in our values—they guide everything we do. We believe that a strong culture leads to meaningful work and lasting impact.

Our Core Values Are


Only the best: We expect the best from our people, we hire people that expect the best from themselves, and we nurture this drive for excellence. 
Ownership: We care deeply about what we do. We take ownership of our initiatives, decisions and outcomes. 
Relentlessly improve: We demand more from ourselves and are always evolving. Continuous, obsessive improvement is the only way we will transform the world of conversational AI. 
Bias for action: Our world moves quickly and so do we. We take calculated risks and we deliver impact fast. 
Disagree and commit: We are all working toward the same goal. If we donʼt agree with something, we work hard to understand it and when a decision is made, we accept it and give it our all. 
Build for people: We are hyper-focused on delivering the best automated experiences possible so that we can empower people to get exactly what they need, when they need it. 


PolyAI is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions at PolyAI will be based on the business needs without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, neurodiversity status or disability status.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job

Data Scientist

Remote (UK-Based)

The Company

This UK-based start-up has grown rapidly in just two years. With a team of ~30 people, they are scaling quickly, supported by recent funding and a strong growth pipeline.

Role: Training Consultant

Type: 12-month FTC, with potential extension for 12–18 months 

Location: UK-wide travel required | Hybrid 

Salary: Up to £33,000 per annum + Company Car




Are you passionate about delivering high-quality, hands-on training that empowers users and enhances operational success? A leading SaaS provider in the healthcare technology space is seeking a Training Consultant to join its growing team. This role plays a key part in ensuring clients get the most out of tailored digital solutions that improve accessibility and efficiency across the industry.




The Role

 You will be responsible for delivering software training directly within client environments, ensuring each implementation is configured and adopted to meet best practice standards. Working closely with the wider training and implementation teams, you’ll contribute to documentation, internal knowledge sharing, and support the planning of new rollouts and product engagement events.




Key Responsibilities

Provide in-person training for clients using bespoke software solutions.
Configure systems in line with client needs to maximise performance and usability.
Support internal teams with documentation and knowledge-sharing resources.
Collaborate with project leads to support rollouts, updates, and engagement campaigns.
Act as a product ambassador at user groups, conferences, and exhibitions.
Contribute to internal training for new hires or cross-functional teams as needed.




What We’re Looking For

Proven experience in a customer-facing training, coaching, or consultancy role.
Strong interpersonal skills with a natural ability to build rapport and engage audiences.
Confident working independently while collaborating with multiple internal teams.
Previous experience delivering training in-person and online (e-learning familiarity is a plus).
Background in healthcare or dental environments would be advantageous.
Willingness to travel extensively across the UK, typically Monday to Friday.




Why Join?

 You’ll be part of an innovative, mission-driven team that values inclusivity, flexibility, and personal development. This is a great opportunity to contribute to meaningful work that directly impacts accessibility and quality of care within the healthcare sector.

title: Electrical Design Engineer
description:
About the job

Your new company 
Our client is a well-established, privately owned consultancy who has beenaround the UK market for years, working in a range of sectors includingeducation, commercial, sports facilities, large scale residential andhealthcare. This company are leaders is sustainability and low-energy buildingservices design. They have high staff retention rates, clear routes ofprogression for staff, regular salary reviews and flexible working options.They are seeking a Electrical Design Engineer (Building Services) to join theirEdinburgh office. You must have experience working in the UK/Ireland deliveringelectrical design on building services projects.
 
 
Your new role 
As an ElectricalEngineer you will play a vital role ensuring sustainability, efficiency andsafety of electrical systems across various building types. You will beresponsible for contributing to electrical design across a range of ourclient's projects, working closely with the electrical team. Your duties willcover design and delivery of electrical design deliverables including drawings,specifications and schedules.

Working in a multidisciplinary environment to design buildings that maximise value while minimising environmental impact
Production of detailed design calculations for all aspects of electrical design.
Production of specifications.

Production of design drawings from conception through to detailed design.
Play an active role in every stage of our client's projects from feasibility to completion across multiple sectors including commercial, residential, education, energy, sport, health, and mixed-use developments.

Master's degree in electrical engineering or other relevant subject.
Working towards Chartered status with CIBSE or IET.

Familiar with BIM processes using Revit, Revitzo or other recognized industry platforms.
Experience in designing HV. LV. Lighting and lighting controls, Fire Alarms, Security/Access Control, electrical design for renewable energy systems and earthing across a range of projects.

 
 
What you'll get in return 

£35,000 to £42,000 annual salary (DOE)
Annual bonus scheme
Annual salary reviews
25 days annual leave + Bank holidays
Option to buy/sell extra holidays
Competitive Pension scheme
Private Medical Insurance
Life Assurance
Accident Insurance
Income Protection Insurance
Hybrid + Flexible working
Learning opportunities
Family friendly policies
Equipment provided for remote work

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now'to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

title: AI Automation Coordinator
description:
About the job

🇬🇧 Up to £35k per year, full-time, permanent contract

🌎 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in the UK!

🏖️ 33 Days Paid Leave

💻 Working with the latest hardware, tech stack and tools




Who We Are 




At Storm Ideas, we supercharge the digital presence of some of the biggest names in US TV and entertainment. Since 2008, our international team has delivered bold, forward-thinking solutions for globally recognised clients.




Whether we're building innovative products, producing high-impact social content, or designing smarter ways for our partners to work—we’re right at the cutting edge of creativity, technology, and automation.




Redefine How We Work With AI 




Emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence present exciting opportunities for us and our clients. As the world adapts, we’re committed to safely exploring the potential advantages of AI, integrating it thoughtfully into our work where possible, and one day guiding our clients through new possibilities when they’re open and ready for them. By tapping into our creativity, expertise, and collaboration, we aim to embrace its potential together. Our vision relies on people who are curious about this technology and excited to take on this challenge!




What You’ll Make Happen 

Explore new AI and low/no-code tools to enhance internal and client workflows
Prototype and recommend solutions that fit team or business needs
Identify and solve process inefficiencies with AI-driven approaches
Help lead tool rollouts, from planning to training and documentation
Support adoption through feedback, config updates, and team enablement
Run training to help teams get the most from new AI tools
Share insights and wins across teams via Slack and other channels
Track adoption and impact using clear metrics and KPIs
Stay ahead of AI trends to keep Storm Ideas at the cutting edge




Your Expertise 

Whether you're early in your career or pivoting into AI, we're looking for curiosity, drive, and a hunger to explore and experiment—especially with new and unfamiliar tech
You're AI-obsessed—tracking the latest tools, models, and trends daily
Some experience using low/no-code tools like Airtable, n8n or Zapier—or excited to learn fast
Familiar with LLMs like ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini—or keen to dive in
Curious and technically adaptable—you enjoy spotting problems and finding smarter ways to do things
Clear, confident communicator who thrives in cross-team collaboration and works independently with precision




Nice to Haves: 

Experience building repeatable AI-powered workflows
Understanding of digital marketing or creative operations workflows
Basic skills in JavaScript or HTML




What It’s Like to Work Here 




Cutting-Edge Tools & Tech 

Work with the latest hardware and software—Windows or Mac—so you're always set up to succeed.




Ideas Welcome, Always 

We don’t just say we’re open to ideas—we act on them. Your insights can shape how we work across the company.




Fast, Agile, Adaptive 

We move like a start-up but with the backing of a larger team. Quick decisions and a responsive culture are the norm.




Incredible Team, Global Reach 

Join an international crew of 175+ passionate, talented people. We hire for skill, drive, and authenticity—just be yourself.




Remote-First & Flexible

Fully remote within the UK, or join us in the Edinburgh office (if you're nearby). Work 9:00–17:30, and feel part of the team wherever you are.




Hiring Process 




First – Online video & Interview

First, you'll complete an online assessment to showcase your skills.
Secondly, an initial Interview to connect and discuss your background, experience, and aspirations.




Second – Task & Interview (60 mins via MS Teams)

Task: Demonstrate your abilities with a project that highlights your expertise.
Final Interview with Leadership: A conversation with Alix, Head of AI Operations and Innovation, and Louise, our CEO, in a dynamic Q&A session.




Not sure if you tick every box? Apply anyway—we care more about your potential and mindset than a perfect match.

title: Survey Mobilisation Engineer
description:
About the job

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Survey Mobilisation Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will play a key role in the planning, scheduling, and execution of mobilisation activities for survey equipment on various vessels.




Key Responsibilities:




Proficient use of AutoCAD (ACAD) for design and layout work
Plan deck layouts for mobilisation operations
Plan, schedule, lead, and monitor mobilisations of spreads to vessels
Create wiring diagrams for systems and equipment
Manage Material Take-Offs (MTO) for all mobilisations
Apply strong understanding of electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic systems




Desired Experience:




Proven experience in Geophysical, ROV (Remotely Operated Vehicle), and Geotechnical mobilisations
Ability to manage and oversee complex mobilisation projects effectively




Location:




Hybrid Working Model: Norwich or Naples office with flexibility for remote work
Working as part of the equipment management team
Mobilisations will be taking place in the North Sea, Baltic Sea, Mediterranean, and East Atlantic.
Please note, this role does not require sailing with the vessel.




If you have a strong background in mobilisation engineering and meet the above criteria, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our dynamic team and work on exciting international projects!

title: Junior Brand Designer
description:
About the job

Junior Brand Designer – Beautiful Brands, Brilliant Team

Salary: £25,000 - £30,000

Hybrid | Flexible Hours | 25 Days Holiday + Bank | Social Culture




We’re working with a design studio that’s creating some of the most refined, thoughtful, and visually striking brand identities out there. They’re now looking for a Junior Brand Designer to join their growing team – someone who lives and breathes branding and wants to craft full brand worlds, from strategy to identity and everything in between.




This isn’t a production-heavy or mixed-role gig – it’s a pure branding position. You’ll be surrounded by an exceptional team who are genuinely passionate about design, with plenty of mentorship and space to grow. Whether it’s typography, storytelling, or shaping a brand’s entire visual language – this is your playground.




What they’re looking for:




✔ A degree in Graphic Design (or a related field)

✔ Studio experience – ideally internships or 1+ years in a similar creative environment

✔ A portfolio that shows full brand identities – not just logos, but brand worlds

✔ A strong eye for detail, layout, and typography

✔ A passion for branding and a desire to grow in a strategic, concept-led environment

✔ Confident using Adobe Creative Suite (especially Illustrator, InDesign, and Photoshop)

✔ Bonus: skills in motion, digital or 3D (but not essential!)




What’s in it for you?




🌿 25 days holiday + bank holidays

🏠 Hybrid working setup

🕐 Flexible hours

🎉 Loads of social events and creative outings

🤝 A supportive, inspiring team

📈 Projects that push your creativity and portfolio further than ever




If you're ready to start your design career surrounded by people who care about craft as much as you do – and want your work to be both meaningful and beautiful – this could be the perfect fit.

title: Data Engineer - Azure
description:

Data Engineer - Healthcare (Azure)

Location: London, UK (Hybrid - 2-3 days in office)
 Job Type: Permanent
 Salary: £60k + Benefits

About the Role:

We're hiring a Data Engineer to join our healthcare client in London. This is a permanent role with a hybrid working pattern (2-3 days in-office). You'll build and manage Azure-based data pipelines that support analytics, reporting, and operational systems across clinical and business functions.

 

Key Responsibilities:

 

Develop and maintain Azure data pipelines (Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)

Strong skills in Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, SQL, Python
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

title: Graduate Researcher (European Languages)
description:
About the job

RECRUITMENT RESEARCH ANALYST




Help our client connect the best people with the world of Private Equity.




Our client does recruitment differently. Our clients return to us time and again because we go beyond expectations. Known for our honest, people-focused approach, we build lasting relationships through exceptional industry knowledge, outstanding communication, and a genuine passion for what we do.




With a global presence spanning London, Germany, Mexico, and Hong Kong, we partner with businesses of all sizes—from boutique investment firms to multinational financial services leaders.




What We Value:

🔹 Creativity & Commitment – Innovative thinking and dedication drive our success.

 🔹 Diversity & Respect – Different perspectives make us stronger.

 🔹 Drive & Determination – We push boundaries to achieve excellence.




Why Join Us?

Our clients tell us we make recruitment feel effortless—friendly, fun, and results-driven. That’s exactly the experience we offer our own team.

Working in close-knit, specialised teams, we blend deep industry expertise with a broad sector reach. Our success is built on long-lasting relationships, and we take pride in making genuine connections that stand the test of time.




What We’re Looking For:

High standards, unwavering enthusiasm, and an eagle eye for detail
Exceptional communication skills and a confident, professional phone manner
A highly organized, methodical approach with strong computer skills
A natural ability to build meaningful, lasting relationships
The self-discipline and confidence to follow up on leads effectively
Absolute discretion and a deep understanding of confidentiality
Fluency in written and spoken English (a second European language is a bonus!)
A valid UK work permit




The Role: A Day in Your Life

As a Recruitment Research Analyst, you’ll play a crucial role in identifying top-tier candidates, engaging with them over the phone, and assessing their suitability for exciting opportunities in the private equity, venture capital, and alternative asset investment sectors.




Your key responsibilities will include:

 🔹 Mapping candidate pools and sourcing top talent from leading firms

 🔹 Expanding our network by conducting database and internet research

 🔹 Building and nurturing long-term relationships with high-calibre professionals

 🔹 Managing the logistics and administration of recruitment assignments

 🔹 Ensuring accurate database input and meticulous information management




What About Experience?

We value potential as much as experience. While a background in executive search, financial services, or sales is beneficial, we’re more interested in your ambition, intellect, and ability to learn. A strong academic background (a bachelor’s degree preferred) will give you an edge.




Ready to Take the Next Step?

If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, we’d love to hear from you! Send us your CV and take the first step toward an exciting career in private equity recruitment.

title: Chartered Structural Engineer
description:
About the job

We're after a thinker! - someone who can really get under the bonnet of our clients problems as well as buildings.




You'll be someone who wants to be part of a small team, lead a small team and in due course be winning work. 




You might be an associate already - or you want to be one.




We work on a really broad range of projects, from healthcare to schools, resi and commercial. Scales from small to £10 to15 million, our core projects are generally £1 to £5million.




What links all of these projects is our approach. REALLY getting to know the problem and the client, then working the full scheme to construction. We don't just size beams.




Ethos: Existing, Natural, then everything else. Sweat what we have, from existing building to opportunities on an empty site.




Projects are mostly London and SE based, so we'll need you to be as well. 




We're based in South London and sometime in the office will be required - but we're very flexible. 




For the right person – you can tell us what you want and how high we need to jump.




All the best, 

John
